Title: Opening directory with \..\ does not resolve path name
Body:
I noticed today that launching Atom on Windows with a folder path including a folder above (`..\`) does not resolve the path name to remove the `..`s, for instance running the command

`atom.exe C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\SubFolder\File.txt`

Gives a window with the title `C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\SubFolder\File.txt`:
![atomrelativefolderfile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6715247/12476171/7905114a-c01f-11e5-8dcd-482994e39380.png)

That's not too much of a problem.

However, if you open a directory as a project from the command line with the last part of the path as a `..`, then it gets a bit messier. Running

`atom.exe C:\Users\Mark\Desktop\ProjectFolder\SubFolder\..\`

Opens the `ProjectFolder` as a project, but with the title "..", which isn't so nice.
![atomrelativefolder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6715247/12476255/f5f2d1c4-c01f-11e5-8d88-9f6dab44f624.png)

Could atom check for this and resolve the path/folder name?

A usage case for this is a software project where you want to launch Atom from another the IDE which makes the IDE project path (for instance in the source sub-directory) available as a parameter, but you want to launch the folder above (which contains the documentation directory and source directory) in Atom.

_Tested on Windows 7 64-bit with Atom 1.4.0_
Label: bug

Title: Opening multiple windows with the same folder(s) leads to improperly restored state
Body:
Repro:
1. Open two windows with the same set of folders open.
2. Open different files in each window.
3. Close Atom with `cmd + q`.
4. Restore Atom from the Dock/Finder. Both windows will have the state of one of the previous windows; the other is permanently lost.

I understand this is due to the way Atom saves project state - it appears to be based off a hash of the set of working directories (which is recorded in `~/.atom/storage/application.json`).

I don't have a great proposal about how to fix this; perhaps in the case of multiple windows the hash could include the window index? It seems to be a fairly uncommon use case, anyhow.
Label: enhancement

This is important feature for me, please fix it. Thanks.

Title: Unable to insert comment marker at start of line
Body:
I'm working on the Fortran language grammar package and I would like it if I could make `cmd+/` insert a comment character in the first column of the selected line/lines. However, it seems the only option available 

``` cson
'.source.fortran.fixed':
  'editor':
    'commentStart': 'C '
```

Inserts the comment character before the first non-whitespace character. For example

``` fortran
       call something()
```

goes to

``` fortran
       C call something()
```

While this works fine for most grammars, this does not work for languages like fixed form Fortran where the comment character **must** be the first character of the line.
Label: enhancement

Title: Unable to paste in "New Folder" input when saving file (OS X)
Body:
Repro Steps:
- Attempt to save a new file or "save as" an existing file
- Click "New Folder" in bottom left of window
- Try to paste some text in the new folder input using Command-V keyboard shortcut

Expected result:
- Text is pasted as the name of the new folder

Actual result:
- highlighted text is not removed or un-highlighted
- text from clipboard is not pasted
- sadness

Additional Notes:
- You _are_ able to right-click and select paste, which works as expected.
- Actions in the Menubar's Edit menu are greyed out in this mode as well
Label: bug

Title: The 'find and replace' result screen should have more features
Body:
After search when the result are shown, there should either be a checkbox for each result so you can pick which result you want to replace, or the user should be able to quickly replace each result so he doesn't have to go to each single result and manually replace the text. Either a right-click command on the result itself, or a little button next to the gutter for each result which replaces and lets you regret it.

It's really annoying when you have to replace something which occurs 99 times, but you want to replace only 75 of them.
Label: enhancement

Title: package specific setting page become not accessible from v1.4.0
Body: After upgraded to v1.4.0, setting can not accessible for page which have `activationCommands`, I first noticed in my package, but confirmed this issue is also happen for symbols-view package. I'm not sure this issue is for settings-view or Atom core. But I believe all package which have `activationCommands` in `package.json` have affect this issue. OS X 10.9.5 Atom v1.4.0 When I reverted to v1.3.3 the issue not happen, OR when I removed activationCommands section from package.json issue not happen(can access setting page via settings-view) The setting page I'm saying is package specific setting page by clicking setting button of specific package panel. Screen capture with `symbols-view` package. When I removed `activationCommands` from `package.json`, setting page become accessible.
Label: bug

Title: Feature request: base64 previews
Body: Would be nice to have previews for base64 blobs. Example here (Brackets): https://igotfryd.wordpress.com/2016/01/13/little-things-that-matter/
Label: enhancement

Title: Add a keep-indentation on newline option rather than auto-indent
Body:
<strike>In some cases I've found the Editor Settings->Auto Indent to misbehave. Don't get me wrong, in many cases it works great. However,</strike> I think it would be great to have the option to indent newlines to exactly match the indentation of the above line, but then not do anything further.

<strike>In the worst case, I've had the auto indent increase indentation for every new line, which I've then had to remove (I think when working with mixed languages in the same file).</strike> It is more often the case I want the indentation the same on a newline and am happy to change it myself at the start and end of blocks.
Label: enhancement

Title: indentation being changed on paste despite auto indent on paste unchecked
Body:
I have both Editor Settings->Auto Indent and Editor Settings->Auto Indent On Paste unchecked and start with a new plain text file (using hard tabs):

```
one
    two
```

where `two` is indented with a tab. I place the cursor at the end of `two`, hold shift, press up and copy the selection. This _should_ copy a newline character, a tab character and the word `two`, i.e. `"\n\ttwo"`. Then I paste, and get this:

```
one
    two
        two
```

somehow an extra tab has been injected. Additional pasting increases the indentation even further! I expected this:

```
one
    two
    two
```

Interestingly, if `one` is also indented before copying, the correct behaviour is observed. It's as though atom is counting the difference in indentation between the lines selected when the text is copied. Personally I hate anything that tries to be too fancy and automatic, and it is _far_ more frustrating to me than the times when something could have predicted what I wanted and didn't.
Label: bug

Title: Atom fails to render this emoji --> ▶? (U+25B6)
Body:
It displays as a blank box, and also counts as two characters. Other emojis seem to render fine and only count as one character.

on osx 10.11.3
atom version 1.3.3 (and version 1.4)

the two character problem is perhaps related to https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8974

Can anyone else reproduce this?
Label: bug

Title: atom shell command broken when run from tmux
Body:
Using the 'atom' shell command:

In tmux: "The application /Applications/Atom.app cannot be opened because its executable is missing."
However, open /Applications/Atom.app works just fine.

Outside of tmux: it opens fine
Label: bug

Title: Atom's Documentation Does Not Tell the End User dpkg Requires Git to be Installed
Body:
I recieved this error while installing atom via dpkg: 

``` bash
$ sudo dpkg --install atom-amd64.deb
[sudo] password for mhiiva: 
Selecting previously unselected package atom.
(Reading database ... 160643 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack atom-amd64.deb ...
Unpacking atom (1.3.3) ...
dpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of atom:
 atom depends on git; however:
  Package git is not installed.

dpkg: error processing package atom (--install):
 dependency problems - leaving unconfigured
Processing triggers for gnome-menus (3.10.1-0ubuntu2) ...
Processing triggers for desktop-file-utils (0.22-1ubuntu1) ...
Processing triggers for mime-support (3.54ubuntu1.1) ...
Errors were encountered while processing:
 atom
```

I have looked over the [Atom on Linux](https://atom.io/docs/v0.194.0/getting-started-installing-atom#atom-on-linux) and the [README](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/README.md), and I found no mention of git being a requirement for atom to be installed. Could this be mentioned in the [README](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/README.md) and [Getting Started Docs](https://atom.io/docs/v0.194.0/getting-started-installing-atom)?
Label: enhancement

Title: Double-click drag selections have unusual and bad behavior on non-word characters
Body:
Note: This may not be a bug in the sense that the behavior may be intended, but many text editors (apple text input boxes, emacs) have better behavior.

To reproduce, enter the following text:

```
multiple words;)
```

Double-click and hold on the word `multiple` - this will select the word `multiple` and as expected enter a "per-word" selection drag.  Move the mouse to the right and the word `words` will be correctly selected all at once.  However, it is impossible to add the `;` to the selection without the `)`.  This is different behavior than you would see in some other text editors, including emacs and Mac OS default input fields.

The reason this is bad is it is harder than other editors to select `multiple words;`, without the close parenthesis.  This seems to come up a lot when programming and is my biggest pet peeve with atom.
Label: bug

Title: Setting for width of new panes to adjust to preferred line length
Body: Ones opened to the right only, obviously…
Label: enhancement

Title: PackageManager.disablePackage() does not check if a package is already disabled
Body:
See https://github.com/burodepeper/language-markdown/issues/70

I assumed `atom.packages.disablePackage()` would do this for me, but it didn't, and now I've polluted a whole bunch of people's configs with duplicates... :oopsie:
Label: bug

Title: Reloading Atom with devtools open and breakpoints deactivated will hit breakpoints
Body:
Possibly an Electron bug?

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Open devtools
2. Add a breakpoint somewhere in Atom's init logic
3. Press the deactivate breakpoints button
4. Reload atom via <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>r</kbd> while devtools is open

**Expected**

The breakpoint is ignored.

**Actual**

The breakpoint is hit.

**Notes**

Breakpoints work again if they are activated and deactivated before resuming the debugger.
Label: bug

Title: Atom (still) always opens keymap.cson on startup
Body:
I can consistently reproduce #9155 from scratch. I'm running Atom 1.3.2 on OS X 10.11.2. This happens when run entirely within safe mode as well.
1. Quit Atom
2. `rm -rf ~/.atom/storage/`
3. Launch Atom via `atom --safe`
4. `cmd-,` (does not work the same with Atom > Preferences menu, see below)
5. Click Keybindings in left rail of Settings
6. Click "your keymap file" link in the top help line of the Keybindings page
7. Close `keymap.cson` buffer
8. Quit
9. Relaunch via `atom --safe`.
10. `keymap.cson` is open, and there's no way to fix this without deleting storage or modifying `initialPaths` in `~/.atom/storage/application.json`.

There is also a variant if you use the Atom > Preferences menu in step 4 instead of `cmd-,`, in which the Settings pane is always open on startup instead of keybindings.
Label: bug

Title: If encoding is set to autodetect, it should autodetect on any external file change
Body:
When external program changes the encoding of an opened file (sets say from UTF8 to UTF16) the file is reload but looks bad.

Every time this happens I must select "change encoding->Auto select" so the files to be shown correctly.
Label: enhancement

Title: When the current window is maximized, opening a new window should open the new one maximized
Body:
From **@50Wliu** on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10236#issuecomment-169855151

> After testing this out on Windows it looks like there needs to be some extra Windows-specific code: opening a new window that spawns from a maximized one should stay maximized and not cascade.
Label: bug

Title: Relocate or rename "Reload" menu item to prevent confusion
Body: See: https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/issues/124
Label: enhancement

Title: OSX: Inconsistent cmd+D behavior
Body:
**Operating system**: OSX El Capitan v10.11.2 (15C50)
**Atom**: v1.3.2

**Description of problem**:

`cmd+D` does not always work as intended. The expected behavior is that it selects the next instance of the highlighted occurrence. For instance, if `sandwiches` is selected, and `cmd+D` is entered, then the next instance of `sandwiches` should be selected. There should be no circumstance where any text aside from `sandwiches` become highlighted after typing `cmd+D`.

Sometimes – seemingly when `D` is pressed too quickly after pressing `cmd` – Atom gets confused and highlights _up until_ the next instance of the text.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Update: [Follow the steps here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10312#issuecomment-170034796)**
# 

Here are some screenshots:

**Expected behavior**

To reproduce these screenshots, press `cmd` and then `d` with at least 100ms of timing between them.

Image 1: this is after pressing `cmd+D` once:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161839/ac9c2d48-b4c8-11e5-891c-3ceb684ef8f0.png)

Image 2: this is after pressing `cmd+D` twice:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161828/932d761e-b4c8-11e5-9e89-ffa9dc4c552f.png)

**Unexpected behavior**

To reproduce these screenshots, type `cmd` and then `D` very quickly. A non-scientific guess is to try to get it down to ~5ms between them.

Image 1: this is after pressing `cmd+D` once:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161857/cbb63c3c-b4c8-11e5-8968-28c4dc6a7d58.png)

Image 2: this is after pressing `cmd+D` twice:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161860/d3600ea4-b4c8-11e5-90d9-64c93db8d820.png)

Is this a bug, or is it intention behavior where it functions differently when the keys are pressed too closely together? I've used Sublime Text for years, and I use this hotkey so frequently that I type it very, very quickly; ST behaves the same way whether there's an appreciable delay or not.
Label: bug

Title: Problems with accented characters in syntax highlighting
Body:
It looks like we may have a problem with accented characters with syntax highlighting. We have [a report](https://discuss.atom.io/t/accents-breaks-syntax-highlighting/24263/6?u=leedohm) that describes this as being a problem in:
- JS
- HTML
- PHP
- CSS

If this can be verified, we should probably do an audit to ensure that all languages that allow UTF-8 encodings utilize regular expressions that recognize the proper character sets. This especially holds true for text or markup languages like HTML.

/cc @atom/languages
Label: bug

Title: Opening files that use atom:// URIs create fake folders
Body:
Opening Settings or any other file that uses a URI will cause a fake folder to appear in the Tree View (eg config, init-script) and `Settings - atom://config` or similar to show up in the titlebar. Reproduce by using a new window.

Tested using safe mode and also reported in #10194, atom/tree-view#690.
Label: bug

Title: File(s) opens in wrong window
Body:
When having two atom windows open, one with a project and one without. If you want to open a file that belongs to the project opened in window 1, and opens the file in window 2, it will be opened in window 1 instead.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open a project / folder, refered to as window 1
2. Open another atom window, refered to as window 2
3. Open a file in window 2 that belongs to the project / folder opened in window 1

**Expected behavior:**

When opening a file from a window, it is expected that the file will open in the window you try to open it in.

**Observed behavior:**

When opening a file from window 2, the file was added to the view of window 1.
This happens both when drag-and-dropping* and using the open file dialog 

\* from the explorer window. I can drag-and-drop from a atom window to another when dragging from tab to tab  
**Atom version:** 1.3.2
**OS and version:** Window 7 Enterprise 64-bit

**Installed packages:**
atom-pair@2.0.10
merge-conflicts@1.3.7
minimap@4.19.0
minimap-git-diff@4.1.8
script@3.3.0
Sublime-Style-Column-Selection@1.3.0

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Unknown
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes
Label: bug

Title: Stop using atom-space-pen-views in all bundled packages
Body:
Let's use a new select-list component that's based on etch: https://github.com/atom/select-list-component.

/cc @kuychaco
Label: enhancement

Title: Smooth scrolling
Body:
Is there any way to add this feature manually? I've searched packages but haven't found anything...

I want to have smooth scrolling like the one in sublime text.
Label: enhancement

Title: editor hangs for very long time with 7.5k file
Body:
I've found similar reports when using Atom with large files but my file is less than 300 lines with less than 150 characters each.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Download and open the file https://github.com/go-gcfg/gcfg/blob/083575c3955c85df16fe9590cceab64d03f5eb6e/set.go#L242
2. Go to the end of line 242 (btw I find it weird that in Windows the last character is not displayed in full so the cursor at the end is also not visible)
3. Press Enter

**Expected behavior:**

New line is started at L243

**Observed behavior:**

Atom editor window hangs for a very long time. (I thought it was indefinite but it came back after an hour or so.) After that, new line is started.

**Screenshots and GIFs**

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/450945/12091952/91203fdc-b33d-11e5-8a6f-8a288456d23a.png)

**Atom version:** 1.3.1 and 1.4.0beta3
**OS and version:** Win8.1 64bit, Debian8.2 64bit

**Installed packages:**

Just the core packages.

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: don't know
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: No
Label: bug

Title: Vertical scrolling when dragging text too fast, no preference for it
Body: There was previously complaints that scrolling was too fast, so an option was added to preferences. It's still the case that if you're scrolling and highlighting text, so moving your mouse off the bottom while clicking and dragging, scrolls about 2x the speed it should. Try this in Sublime Text, or Xcode, where it's a much slower speed.
Label: enhancement

Title: atom --wait should open files in a tab instead of a new window
Body:
When I use `atom .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG`, the file is opened in the current atom window, that's fine.

But when I use `atom --wait .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG`, the file is opened in a new window with working directory of ".git", which is quite slow and not what I want.
Label: enhancement

Title: Column selection extends over wrapped parts of lines
Body:
According to the thread https://discuss.atom.io/t/vertical-column-selection/15913/7 we can do a column selection. On Windows, I can use Ctrl-Alt-Up / Down do extend the selection vertically.
This is nice and useful. But alas, this is a bit ruined when line wrapping is active (the default on Atom, I think).
I think this selection extension should skip over the wrapped part of the long lines: it makes no sense to extend the selection to these parts, as they are random (depend on the width of the editor!) and not aligned with anything.
Label: enhancement

Title: Enhance Atom's Mac Services support to include text services (editor not NSText)
Body:
Atom's Service support includes non text services. However, as the Atom text editor is a custom component not identified as text, the text services aren't show.

Thank you for your help. Don't hesitate to ask for further details if necessary.

Issue raised from conversation at https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3204#issuecomment-167715168
Label: enhancement

Title: should close all files when project folder removed
Body: when the project being removed, the files are still open.
Label: enhancement

Title: Enhancement suggestion: Make non-printing control-character (etc.) constants visible
Body:
1. I don't know if this Enhancement Suggestion belongs in atom/atom or in atom/language-ruby.  I do suspect that this enhancement also applies to other languages such as Python, Perl, etc., not exclusively to Ruby; given its display-oriented nature, it does seem (to me) to be Atom/core rather than syntax/language- (Ruby-) dependent.
2. See attached screenshots for comparison between what Sublime Text 3 does and what Atom does not yet do... but should.  These two screenshots show exactly the same file/lines of code in both Atom and in Sublime Text.  The Atom screenshot was taken in v1.1, but the same behavior exists in v1.3 (my current Atom).
3. In Ruby (also in other languages), a constant (or variable) can be declared as at Line 31 (in both screenshots), for example a constant ESC (an "Escape" character code) which has a single character code (integer) value.  Other instances of this sort of thing would include CSI (Control Sequence Introducer), SI (Shift-In), SO (Shift-Out) char-code values, etc.

Once declared, Sublime Text will render a graphic, e.g., a reverse-video'd "ESC" wherever that character-code value occurs in subsequent character strings... Atom does not.

See Lines 32--59 for the Sublime Text screenshot, which clearly shows "ANSI Escape Sequence" strings of characters (including in comments!) -- the corresponding lines in the Atom screenshot do not, thus implying that these "ANSI Escape Sequence" characters strings are malformed and missing the leading ESC character.
1. Suggestion/request is to enhance Atom (or syntax/language packages, especially Ruby) to recognize such character-code constants (&/or variables) and render them visibly as part(s) of character strings where these occur (mimicking Sublime Text in this regard).
2. My environment/versions:
   $ atom -v
   1.3.0
   $ uname -a
   Linux alikot 3.13.0-74-generic #118-Ubuntu SMP Thu Dec 17 22:52:10 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
3. Sample screenshots: Atom (#1) and Sublime Text (#2)
   ![rubyconstants-in-atom-v1-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1362449/12023462/f1c5de60-ad56-11e5-8c99-181fed03082f.png)

Thank you for your kind consideration and any guidance...

Title: Show invisibles only when selecting text
Body: I really hate to always see invisibles but they are useful sometimes… Some apps like Sublime Text only show invisibles when text is selected and it'd be great if there was such an option in Atom.
Label: enhancement

Title: RTL text selection
Body:
When trying to select a RTL substring, the highlighted text seems to be current but if you just press delete button, It will delete another part of the text instead of highlighted.

also double clicking on the text will highlight another word/part of text. 

It behaves like the position of the mouse is horizontally invert on the RTL text.

Simulate it:
First Test:
این یک متن ?ارسی است
Select این With mouse down and mouse up and Press Delete button, and it will delete است instead of این:
این یک متن ?ارسی 

Second Test:
این یک متن ?ارسی است
Double click on رسی
رسی will be Highlighted but if you press delete, این will be deleted.
Label: bug

Title: Pressing End key twice should move to end of line
Body:
Open a document with a long line (example attached), so that it wraps. 
1. Press the End key. The cursor should move to the end of the screen line. This works correctly.
2. Press the End key again. The cursor should move to the end of the logical line. However nothing happens.

This works correctly in other editors: Sublime Text and Notepad++.

Similarly, pressing the Home key twice should always move the cursor to the start of logical line.

[alice.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/65536/alice.txt)
Label: enhancement

Title: Cannot open the same file multiple times
Body:
1. Drag a file into Atom.
   - Atom opens a new window, or adds it to an existing one.
2. Open a second window.
3. Attempt to open the same file in the second window.
   - Atom refuses to open it, taking you back to the first window.

Tested on Atom 1.3.2, OS X 10.11.1. Even notepad lets you open a file multiple times. And no, splitting it into a new pane (`Cmd+K, right`) does not work. I need to view the unedited file in one window and the edited file in another, possibly making divergent edits.

Bizarrely, if the original window is split with `Cmd+K, right` on that exact tab, opening it in another pane, and that second view is dragged into a new window, then this works (even though dragging the split tab back into the first pane hilariously [crashes](10109) atom).
Label: enhancement

Title: Keybinding for toggling comments duplicated
Body:
How can I solve this:
ctrl-/ Toggles line comments
ctrl-; Also toggle line comments but is not listed on keybindings
Now I want to make a new keybinding for ctrl-; but the line comment bind always overrides my keybind.
Label: bug

Title: Prompt before opening large files to avoid making the editor hang by mistake
Body:
We know that atom hangs when opening big files (#979). Usually I don't intend to open big files, but sometimes I do because of using the CMD+T dialog too fast, so by mistake. Can we prevent this with a small action the user has to take before ? Given that the the user has to wait a while when the file is opened, I think that warning the user and prompting to open is a small request. Then your team can focus on improving performance without getting many users frustrated until then.

![atom_open_big_file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/570771/11843199/7df7c7c0-a408-11e5-8a36-477638bbd884.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: Do not handle package activation exceptions in test mode.
Body: I've run into difficulty writing tests a few times when my package failed to activate but the test environment didn't have anything interesting in the console or test output indicating that's where it failed. In `package.coffee` we should just re-raise if we're in test mode rather than calling `::handleError`. I plan to do this today, just writing up this issue to remind myself when I switch contexts (or in case I never get to it!)
Label: enhancement

Title: Soft hyphen and Non-breaking space invisible when Invisibles are activated (OS X)
Body:
The [Soft Hyphen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soft_hyphen) is a useful character. It should be visible when Invisibles are turned on.

Atom 1.2.4 on OS X 10.11.1

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. In Atom, turn on invisibles through the Shift+CMD+P menu and place the cursor where you want to insert the soft hyphen
2. Open the OS character window with Ctrl+CMD+Space
3. Search for the Soft Hyphen and double click on it to insert into Atom
4. Nothing happens
5. Open the file in another editor, e.g. TextWrangler. The hyphen is there.
Label: enhancement

Body:

![screen-position-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11777765/c08e151c-a250-11e5-9731-7027555b7257.gif)

In the gif above, the update of the views is scheduled on a new frame during the `did-change` event of the text editor. I have more or less the same result if I do the update immediately. And as far as I can tell it was still working properly last week.

Title: Quitting and re-opening Atom does not save the same tabs I had open
Body:
Whenever I quit Atom and re-open it, the same 3 tabs from something I was working on 6 months ago always open and _not_ the thing I was just working on.

I have uninstalled and installed the `save-session` package multiple times, no luck.

This is version 1.3.1.

I'm guessing some file somewhere has these 3 files of mine saved and this file just never gets updated?
Label: bug

Title: Atom hangs on opening multiple same name files with similar paths
Body:
When trying to open multiple files with the same name but under slightly different paths, atom crashes.

**Reproduction Steps:**

**1**. Create the following folder and file structure outside of Atom. Files do not need to have any content.

```
root/
      folder1/ 
             sub1/
                  file.txt
             sub2/
                  file.txt
      folder2/ 
             sub1/
                  file.txt
             sub2/
                  file.txt
```

**2**. Open the folder `root` in Atom using File -> Open Folder
**3**. Open any three files by clicking on them in the Tree View

**Expected behavior:**
Atom opens up all three files in their own tabs

**Observed behavior:**
Atom editor stops responding on trying to open the third file, a few seconds later a dialog pops up asking to wait or close. Wait never resolves so closing is the only cause of action. The developer console shows no exception.

**Atom version:** 1.3.1
**OS and version:** Windows 7

**Installed packages:**
None

**Additional information:**
This bug occurs on a fresh install of atom with zero config changes or package installs.
I believe this has something to do with how the tabs are named with files that have the same name. 
When opening two files you get one of the following tab names
- `folder1\...\file.txt` | `folder2\...\file.txt`
- `sub1\file.txt` | `sub2\file.txt`

However when you open a third file, Atom doesn't know how to name the 3rd tab because if it tries to follow one of the formats above, it will have two files that have identical tab names. e.g.

`folder1\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder1\sub1\file.txt) | `folder2\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder2\sub1\file.txt) | `folder1\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder1\sub**2**\file.txt)
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: **Yes**
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: **Yes**
  - Can't reproduce this problem in 1.2.3 Windows 7 or 1.2.0 Linux Debian. It's worth noting that 1.2 formats the tab names differently (`file.txt - folder1\sub1`)
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: **Yes**
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: **Yes**
Label: bug

Title: Add ability to save as default filetype
Body: Add ability to save as default filetype. So I can set to ".html" and all files onwards will have the automatic extension .html appended to the filename when trying to save the file.
Label: enhancement

Title: Atom freezes with split panes on OS X
Body:
To reproduce:

``` sh
$ mkdir -p atom_test/{lib,test}
$ cd atom_test
$ touch lib/transport.js test/transport.js
```

Add some content to the two files. Open one of the files and then split the pane vertically. After splitting the panes, atom freezes and requests to close. 

It only seems to happen if the filename is the same, but they are in different directories. (`test/transport.js` and `lib/transport.js`)

Atom version: v1.3.1
Darwin Mac-Pro.local 15.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 15.0.0: Sat Sep 19 15:53:46 PDT 2015; root:xnu-3247.10.11~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

What is really weird is that it just started doing it out of the blue. I have tried removing ~/.atom/storage and it still does not work.
Label: bug

Title: Scrollbars can't be styled without making them visible the whole time
Body:
It sounds funny, I know. But it looks like it's currently not possible to style the editor's scrollbars without making them visible the whole time. Just try it: Add some stylings to your theme's stylesheet and suddenly the scrollbars will be visible the whole time.

I've tried it, too. If you want to see an example, just clone [material-ui](https://github.com/leo/material-ui/blob/master/styles/atom.less) and comment out the last few lines. Usually, this should just change the look of the scrollbars. But what it really does is making the scrollbars visible the whole time (independed from your OS' settings).

I also haven't yet seen a theme that managed to style them without making them visible the whole time. Would be awesome if this could be fixed! :see_no_evil:
Label: enhancement

Title: Show user-made API documentation on mouse hover, like in Eclipse, NetBeans or IntelliJ/PHPStorm
Body:
[There](https://atom.io/packages/api-docs) [are](https://atom.io/packages/quick-docs) [a lot of](https://atom.io/packages/live-doc-viewer) [Atom](https://atom.io/packages/quickdoc) [packages](https://atom.io/packages/devdocs) (? 5 links in there) which show API documentation in different ways, but none of them show user-made docs (Javadoc/JSDoc/PHPDoc format), only general language API documentation, for example from [DevDocs](http://devdocs.io/).

There are even packages like [jsdoc](https://atom.io/packages/jsdoc) or [docblockr](https://atom.io/packages/docblockr) which help the user by generating the documentation comments, but it seems that there are no packages which can read and display those comments on hover or click and there is no such functionality in Atom itself.

Example of the functionality in Eclipse:
![Eclipse Javadoc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2381553/21856834/97207daa-d823-11e6-916a-a28c850234fc.png)

Title: Inconsistent file formatting for exceptions on Windows
Body:
I noticed while running specs that the way that there's absolutely no consistency in how the file is displayed in exceptions (eg the `at file:line:column` display)

Examples:
- `C:\Users\user\Documents\GitHub\atom\spec\text-editor-component-spec.js` - Expected, this seems to be super rare though :frowning: 
- `file:///C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/spec/project-spec.coffee` - Acceptable, much more common
- `C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/spec/text-editor-component-spec.js` - Technically not correct.  This only seems to appear when the file isn't wrapped in parentheses (so it also doesn't have a function associated with it).  Probably just forgetting to relativize the path.
- `file:\C:\Users\user\Documents\GitHub\atom\spec\config-spec.coffee` - ..._what_?  Seems to be the most common too :worried:.  I'm going to take a quick guess and say that the relativizing of paths is just converting `/` to `\`, leading to `file:\\\C` which is escaped to `file:\C`.
- `/C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/src/buffered-process.coffee` - Definitely not correct.  This only occurs in custom logging, for example the config and deserializer validation (`source: /C:/file (line)`).  No idea what's happening here.

In addition, outside of specs, there's also a lot of inconsistency:  most exceptions will thankfully be either of the form `C:\` or `file:///C:/` though.  However, the `/C:/` version is displayed for errors from `init.coffee` (`At /C:/Users/user/.atom/init.coffee:4`).  The actual stacktrace contains the `file:///` version though: `at atom-text-editor.atom.commands.add.custom:trigger-error (file:///C:/Users/user/.atom/init.coffee:17:2)`.

Only the `C:\` and `file:///C:/` versions are properly caught by the Notifications package.
Label: bug

Title: No response when running atom at one side of desktop (Windows)
Body:
I have a problem with atom (version 1.2.4) on my Windows 10 laptop. In Windows we can split the view and run applications side by side using Win+LEFT or Win+RIGHT key. When we run atom at one side, even if we keep atom at front, typing keyboard won't have any response until the window is restored or maximized.

Here is the way to reproduce the problem.
1. Open atom, maximize the window, type some content.
2. Type Win+RIGHT to set atom to the right of the screen.
3. Keep atom at front, type keyboard (no response this time).
4. Maximize the window, the content will now show up.
Label: bug

Title: Moving a folder in the Tree View does not close the corresponding file buffers.
Body:
When dragging a file in the Tree View into a different folder, any buffers of this file are closed. I guess, this is desired behaviour. (Alternatively, the buffer could stay open and internally change the file it is referring to, but this is another topic.)

However, the behaviour is different when instead of a file a whole folder is moved (via drag and drop) in the Tree View: Buffers of files in the folder stay open, and upon closing them manually, a dialogue "file.xyz has changes, do you want to save them?" is triggered. This is certainly not good behaviour. The buffers should be closed instead.

Furthermore, if the file is not yet added to git, it is marked green in the Tree View, along with all higher level folders. If now a folder with such a new file is moved, the green marking does not update properly for the higher level folders.

Using:
atom 1.2.4
tree-view 0.195.0
ubuntu 14.04
Label: bug

Title: OnDidChange TextEvent values not set correctly upon single newline character.
Body:
### Reproduce:

Subscribe to the TextEditor OnDidChange event and simply output the TextEvent object to the console log.
Enter a newline into a new text buffer in the UI (Hit Enter/Return) to fire off the OnDidChange event.
Examine the logged console object:
1. The TextEvent object field 'newText' does not include the newline character, it is an empty String.
2. The oldRange values are incorrect for the end/start fields.  They show the same position as the newRange.

Compare this to a backspace/delete that removes the newline and moves the cursor up one row.
The TextEvent object field 'oldText' includes the newline character that was deleted.
I think the two operations should be inverses, and the values of oldText/newText fields mirrors of each other in either situation at the very least.

_Update:_
The TextEvent does fire, but an additional TextEvent with invalid information also occurs.

**Atom Version:** 1.2.4
**System:** Ubuntu 14.04.3
### Done When:

The additional event that describes no change (newText and oldText both empty Strings) does not occur.
Label: bug

Title: Headless testing doesn't show deprecations
Body:
One of the coolest features of the original test infrastructure is that it displayed deprecations when you ran tests:

![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 10 27 16 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/11429133/99c3b26a-9428-11e5-9018-b74ba2d43495.png)

The new headless testing system (and also `apm test`) doesn't support this feature:

```
[atom-test-deprecate][~/Source/tabs-to-spaces] atom --test spec
Error Downloading Update: Could not get code signature for running application
[54439:1126/102639:INFO:CONSOLE(51)] "Window load time: 280ms", source: file:///Users/Lee/github/atom/static/index.js (51)
............................

Finished in 1.47 seconds
28 tests, 32 assertions, 0 failures, 0 skipped
```

I don't want us to lose this valuable piece of feedback for package authors.

I added the `atom-test-deprecate` branch to my [tabs-to-spaces package](https://atom.io/packages/tabs-to-spaces) for easy testing of this feature.
Label: enhancement

Title: Crashes or hangs when reloading large file
Body:
I have a large file (11,266 lines) that's being generated from a code generation script.  If I leave that file open in Atom and regenerate the code, which is done by redirecting stdout from a Python script, Atom will regularly hang or outright crash.  Sometimes you can do this a half dozen times, other times it will hang or crash on the first rewrite of the file.

Expected behavior is to refresh and reload the file in Atom.

As seen in Atom 1.0.6 and 1.2.4 on Ubuntu 15.04.  Happens in safe mode as well.

Also reproducible in OSX with Atom 1.2.2 and 1.2.4.  Will be attaching the crash logs from Console.app shortly.

How I can reliably reproduce the bug (requires Python 2.7, `pip install html2text`):

From the https://github.com/DualSpark/rusoto/tree/feature-better-s3-codegen branch, run: 

``` bash
git submodule init
git submodule update
```

``` bash
cd codegen
./botocore_parser_s3.py botocore/botocore/data/s3/2006-03-01/service-2.json S3Client > s3.rs
```

That generates the code.  Now, open `codegen/s3.rs` in Atom and re-run the `./botocore_parser_s3.py botocore/botocore/data/s3/2006-03-01/service-2.json S3Client > s3.rs` command.  Atom will hang reloading the file, or crash outright.  If it doesn't crash or hang, running the command a few more times will cause a hang or crash.  Once or twice for Ubuntu, four to five times for OSX.
Label: bug

OSX 10.11.1

Title: Atom does not launch unless done by `sudo atom` in terminal - Ubuntu 14.04
Body:
As the title suggests, after installing Atom for the first time on an Ubuntu 14.04 machine, Atom does not load when either the icon is clicked or when launched by the terminal with `atom`. The icon pops up in the launcher, but no window is ever launched. 

After filtering for the word `atom` in `htop`, I can see that the following processes are being run on my system (see image below).

When trying to launch Atom in safe mode, I get the following output, followed by my terminal hanging indefinitely.

```
[03:37 PM] [~] $ /usr/bin/atom: line 106: /home/lancelafontaine/.atom/nohup.out: Permission denied
App load time: 275ms


```

However, when typing `sudo atom` in the terminal, a window does end up launching (see image).

In the Atom menu in the top bar, there are the following options: `[Check for Update, Reload, Close Window, Toggle Dev Tools, Quit]`

The Dev Tools console displays the following message.

```
Error: EACCES: permission denied, open '/home/lancelafontaine/.atom/compile-cache/less/df1b7fbc57dbeed23a8f1f8de95b4dfebcc06066/imports.json'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:549:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:137:20)
    at Object.fs.writeFileSync (fs.js:1171:15)
    at Object.fsPlus.writeFileSync (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/fs-plus/lib/fs-plus.js:279:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.writeJson (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:155:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.setImportPaths (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:113:12)
    at new LessCache (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:32:12)
    at new LessCompileCache (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/less-compile-cache.js:20:20)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadLessStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:270:26)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:257:21)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.requireStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:174:24)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.reloadBaseStylesheets (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:237:12)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadBaseStylesheets (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:232:19)
    at new AtomEnvironment (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:246:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:28:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:49:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:190:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at setupWindow (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js:79:5)
    at window.onload (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js:35:9)handleSetupError @ index.js:56
```

**Reproduction Steps and Observed Behavior:**
1. Whenever launched via Launcher icon, no window appears.
2. Whenever launched via terminal with `atom`, no window appears.

**Expected behavior:**

Expected behaviour is that the editor launches a window and loads.

**Screenshots and GIFs**

![screenshot from 2015-11-25 15 20 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548285/11408590/2a926d3c-9388-11e5-9416-274c1d13d36a.png)

However, when typing `sudo atom` in the terminal, a window does end up launching (see image).

![screenshot from 2015-11-25 15 22 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548285/11408825/a4db0bc0-9389-11e5-8073-baf0f159270b.png)

**Atom version:** 1.2.4
**OS and version:** Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

**Installed packages:**

This occurs when launching Atom for the first time after install. Only the default packages are included in atom.

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Yes
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes
Label: bug

Title: Atom uploading user data without explicit permission

Title: Scrollbar and file position don't match
Body:
Hello there.

After start Atom with last project scroll is up, but redactor position different.

Atom 1.2.4.

Screenshot:
![2015-11-25 11 09 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4338636/11391699/756ec01c-9365-11e5-9d26-3c77adfc546c.png)
Label: bug

Title: Screen blinks and some parts become dark
Body:
Hi,

Since a few versions I got a strange problem. I am running Atom 1.2.3 (such a great tool by the way) under Linux (with Gnome3). I will try to describe what happens :

Sometimes, it's like the main view is blinking. For example, if I go to another tab, some white parts will appear for one second at the bottom and the right of my pane.

Furthermore, if I create a new file/folder (yeah it happens sometimes...), when I start typing the name of my new file in the box dialog, this last one will become completly black. It is a bit disturbing :)

I don't know if these two things are linked, but they start happening at the same time. Guess it starts around the 1.2.0 release, but I really not sure. I try to find another issue linked to this one, but my search was not really prolific...

I will keep looking to from source of this troubles, but if anyone has an idea....

Thanks.
Label: bug

Title: rename beta installer
Body:
> The Atom Beta runs side-by-side with the Atom stable release

Though you can't save the installer of both versions in the same folder, since they have the same name.  :fearful:
Perhaps _-beta._ for their file names would help things out?  Sometimes I keep around the file, or transfer to multiple computers via a USB drive; would be nice to know what channel the installer is.
Label: enhancement

Title: `stylesheet` persists in the treeview
Body: Immediately after a fresh reinstall of Atom (before installing any packages), after `Edit > Open Your Stylesheet`, a folder or file `stylesheet` is created in the treeview. Copy-paste its full path (from context menu) shows `atom://.atom/stylesheet`. Every time I restart Atom, no matter what files I had open in the previous session, `stylesheet` is in the treeview. I'm using Atom 1.2.3 on Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS
Label: bug

Title: Package doesn't show keyboard shortcut
Body:
I am using the [atom-preview](https://github.com/Glavin001/atom-preview) package / plugin. It has a keyboard shortcut to show and hide the preview pane. Unfortunately it doesn't show me the shortcut when I am searching for it with control + shift + p like other packages I am using. I've created an issue for that https://github.com/Glavin001/atom-preview/issues/117 and the author of the package told me to ask the question here.

Could you tell me why Atom doesn't display the command Ctrl+Alt+Y?

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/149248/11334652/b97f032e-91d6-11e5-9287-264e0695b579.png)
Label: bug

Title: Ligatures: put cursor inside of glyph
Body:
when the cursor is inside of ligatures, it appears as if it was behind the last character.

firefox solves the problem by simply dividing the ligature width into parts equal to the number of ligated (ligatured?) characters and putting the cursor accordingly.

we should do the same.
Label: enhancement

Title: Update coffeescript version
Body:
atom /atom has the dependency `coffee-script": "1.8.0` in package.json.  1.8.0 is over a year old.  1.9.0 introduced a lot of improvements including generators and the yield statement.  I have a package that would _really_ benefit from generators.

Should I put in a pull request for this?
Label: enhancement

Title: Files opened externally now opened in new window even if project window already open
Body: After one of the latest Atom updates, files opened from the file system are no longer opened in one of the existing windows, but rather in a window of their own. Can this be disabled somewhere in the preferences to go back to the old behaviour? Unless improvements are made so that opening a new Atom window doesn't take 5+ seconds, it's really detrimental to your work flow if you have to wait that long for opening a single file that you just want to copy some contents from.
Label: bug

Title: No longer possible for package to have a pane item deserialized along text editors
Body:
Actually it works on 1.2.1 but is broken on beta.

In [tablr](https://github.com/abe33/atom-tablr) I have made my CSV editor class serializable so that quitting Atom with a csv editor open restores it on the next run. For that purpose I have a method on my package main module that loads all the models and views required to make that possible and registers the deserializers as soon as the package is loaded: 

![tablr_coffee_-__users_c_nehemie_github_tablr_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11245265/19604b86-8e12-11e5-9f94-06a1fe0ec839.png)

However, as you can see below, when reloading Atom with my table editor open, it first tries to deserialize the object, and then loads the package: 

![tablr_coffee_-__users_c_nehemie_github_tablr_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11245281/2f636f1c-8e12-11e5-8f71-eafd5d519c2d.png)

Is it a regression? Or was it decided to remove this feature?
Label: bug

Title: Using atom as a background process fails sometimes on Mac
Body:
We use atom as a background process. It has started to fail on a Mac since version `1.2`. Refs https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/728

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Install Atom-typescript
2. Open a TypeScript file
3. Wait 3-6 minutes

**Expected behavior:**

The background worker should continue to work

**Observed behavior:**

If fails with error : 

``` ts
/Users/tomi/.atom/packages/atom-typescript/dist/worker/lib/workerLib.js:180 CHILD ERR STDERR: Atom Helper(63023,0x7fff74876000) malloc: *** error for object 0x7f923840ce20: pointer being freed was not allocated
```

**Screenshots and GIFs**

In dev console: 

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/376203/11227621/e7faab62-8d3b-11e5-89ba-c59d4e732bc0.png)

**Atom version:** 1.2
**OS and version:** Mac OSX 

**Installed packages:**

atom-typescript, linter

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Only happens if you use the package
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Yes
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes
Label: bug

Title: Atom Beta - v1.3.0-beta0 - Unable to update SSL error
Body:
When attempting to update the Beta I am seeing the following message 

```
An SSL error has occurred and a secure connection to the server cannot be made.: (null)
```

The release version updated successfully, so I doubt this is a local environment issue.

What additional information can I provide?
Label: bug

Title: Problem With Horizontal Scroll in Specific Condition
Body:
I have created a file to replicate this problem here:
https://gist.github.com/mssio/2e559b6d53de7a2e2438

Before you copy the content of the files in Atom please make sure that the width of your atom window is not super wide (can't display more than 150 chars) and the height of your atom window is not super tall (can't display more than 60 lines). Also make sure that the atom configuration on soft wrap is turned off.

After you copy the file you can see on line 1, everything is normal, you can use horizontal scroll and continue typing on line 1 and automatically scrolled to follow the cursor. But let's try to see the line 105, in that line we can't do a horizontal scroll and if I type on that line, the window will not follow the cursor.

This is really annoying problem because a lot of my code have a format like this and when I am in the middle / bottom, I will not be able to edit the code using Atom. I have to switch to another text editor.

I hope this is not a duplicate issue, please just close it if it is a duplicate. And I am sorry for my bad English.
Label: bug

Title: bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor counts tabs as spaces
Body:
I tried to call editor.bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor(".string") to get range of currently selected string. Then I tried to get that string by calling editor.getTextInBufferRange(range). It works as expected and I get entire string if line is indented with spaces.

If line is indented with tabs, returned string starts several characters to the right, it is the right length (or cropped if there are no more characters). bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor seems to be counting single tab as multiple characters (based on its width), while getTextInBufferRange counts tab as only one character.

For example, if line starts with 2 tabs (4 chars wide) immediately followed by string, start column of range returned from bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor is 8 (or undefined, see below). Since getTextInBufferRange counts tab as one character, it returns string starting with eighth character which is already 6 letters inside of string I was trying to get.

Let's assume this code:

```
range = editor.bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor(".string")
editor.getTextInBufferRange(range)
```

and this input:

```
\t\t"my string", some other text
```

If cursor is placed before "r", bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor returns undefined. That is because editor.getCursorBufferPosition (used internally by bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor) counts tab as one character and therefore it returns column < 8, which as far as bufferRangeForScopeAtPosition (also used internally by bufferRangeForScopeAtCursor) is concerned is not within any string.

If cursor is placed after "r", it returns "ring", some".

When you look at tokenizedLines in TokenizedBuffer for that line, you see that tags start [4,4,...] (4 may be replaced by actual tab width) and as far as I can currently tell this seems to be the problem. I assume that either tokenizer should not count tabs as multiple characters or bufferRangeForScopeAtPosition should not take tags as buffer column numbers.
Label: bug

Title: Enable clipboard actions in Settings screen
Body:
It's quite inconvenient that you can't copy text in the Settings page. Quite often I have to copy config values, having to go to the project's GitHub page. Is there a workaround for this? Or any particular reason why it's restricted?

![screenshot 2015-11-17 10 01 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1636476/11208356/90b106ea-8d12-11e5-8e7d-fecef673fd4c.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: atom not launching/application.json
Label: bug

Title: Undo/Redo stack cleared on save when the file is changed before save
Body:
Hi,

I used the Undo feature to go back into a stage that I desire to check something in my code. I went back something like 50 times. I checked watherever I was looking for and then I was ready to go back to the last stage by using Ctrl+Y. Unfortunatelly, the Redo feature only worked something like 20 times, and I lost some code.

Did anyone have the same issue?

P.S.: Hope this is the right place to post about it...
Label: enhancement

Title: Strange marker behavior when scrolling with soft wrap enabled
Body: Just noticed the following behavior on latest master (1.4.0-dev-2696f49) with spellcheck lines and find-and-replace selections: ![oh-spellchecker](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/11184315/22439416-8c77-11e5-8ad0-29256988c9da.gif) ![oh-markers](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/11184314/22324f80-8c77-11e5-8f8c-01edc378723f.gif) Notice how the markers somehow translate from line to line as the top edge of the editor scrolls over the line with the marker (I'm only _guessing_ this is marker related since it can be reproduced with both spellcheck lines and find-and-replace selections, I haven't investigated this further). I was able to reproduce this with a bunch of lorem ipsum snippets wrapped to 80 chars (notice the top line which has double spellcheck lines): cc @nathansobo @as-cii for more :eyes: Also, not sure if this is related, but https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8007 has similar keywords as this.
Label: bug

Title: Atom icon in the taskbar not found - replaced by windows icon for non found image
Body:
The issue happens all of a sudden, I suppose probably after an automatic update

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1294805/11177834/af79e012-8c48-11e5-80e8-d751c2f57734.png)

I search for a similar issue, maybe related to #8789 ?
Label: bug

Title: Atom hangs when docked to left or right side of screen - Windows
Body:
After moving Atom to the left side of my screen using windows shortcut (Win+left arrow key) or (Win+right arrow key), Atom hangs. However, when I move it around or make it full screen. Atom starts to work again.

I've tried this in safe mode and I experience the same problem.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9221137/11175853/7b838156-8bfc-11e5-84c9-36f6b10f5e63.png)

Edit: I've found an easy way to reproduce it somewhat consistently. If you open one atom instance and move it to the right or left side and then open a second atom instance and move it to the other side. The second atom instance will hang. As shown in the picture below.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9221137/11176488/31238848-8c03-11e5-8ba9-e817b9729b75.png)
Label: bug

Title: Portable 1.3b0 on Windows uses sibling folder for config
Body:
When using the new --portable command line param, my .atom folder is moved to be a sibling of my Atom folder.  I was expecting to see .atom appear within that folder (as a sibling to the executable) and it took me a while to figure out why I didn't see it there.

Would it be possible to make that change?  I think a lot of folks take 'portable' to mean that they can drag a single folder to a new destination and a hidden sibling folder complicates that.
Label: enhancement

Title: Deserialization error: states is not defined (Atom-1.2.0)
Body:
I'm not entirely sure what I did to trigger this, but it does appear to be a typo in https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/f9a269ed995c4151678aef787573fe44657ed6dd/src/project.coffee#L58

```
index.js:56 ReferenceError: states is not defined
    at Project.module.exports.Project.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/project.js:98:9)
    at AtomEnvironment.module.exports.AtomEnvironment.loadStateSync (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:906:22)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:38:8)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:51:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:190:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
```
Label: bug

Title: Problem with opening file in OS X and shortcut Go to directory
Body:
I can't use my favorite shortchut in OS X (10.11 El Capitan). The Atom's version is 1.2.0. 
I have a french keyboard (AZERTY one)

I copy a file path with the finder. Let's say /Users/john
- i want to open a file in Atom : Cmd-O
- a finder-like windows appears. i want to go through a directory with the shortcut Cmd-Shift-G
- i can't paste the path /Users/john what is not the expected behavior

!**Installed packages:**
I have no addtionnal package installed. 
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes on 2 devices
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes
Label: bug

Title: Rebuild packages fails in Beta
Body: Similar to https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8837, however this only happens with the Atom Beta build, no _Incompatible Package_ issues in stable build. Upon opening Atom, even in safe mode, a red bug icon appears. The screen it leads to reveals that > Some installed packages could not be loaded because they contain native modules that were compiled for earlier version of Atom. Clicking the button to `Rebuild Packages` fails giving the errors shown below. Note the target path for the Make command is odd and seems to point to the non-beta version. `../../../../../../../../../../../../Applications/Atom` ![screen shot 2015-11-13 at 19 03 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1646307/11155004/9e33161c-8a3a-11e5-90e0-41f047edeaeb.png) If i navigate to the package folder and run the rebuild command, it succeeds with `apm` but fails with `ape-beta` giving same output as above. This is on OS X 10.11.1, running NVM if it makes a difference.
Label: bug

Title: If atom is launched on non-primary monitor, dropdowns appear in wrong place
Body:
1. Open atom on non-primary screen ( You do this by moving terminal to non primary screen, and typing "atom ." to launch)
2. go to preferences -> Settings, go to "Tab length", click dropwdon
3. Notice that drop down appears in wrong place, or doesn't appear ( likely due to rendering off screen)
4. Drag atom to primary screen
5. Click dropdown, notice it is positioned properly
6. Drag atom back to non-primary monitor
7. Click tab length dropdown
8. Notice it works properly now.

Atom 1.1.0

uname -a: 
Linux lnx-daniel 3.13.0-37-generic #64-Ubuntu SMP Mon Sep 22 21:28:38 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

/etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_ID=LinuxMint
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.1
DISTRIB_CODENAME=rebecca
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Linux Mint 17.1 Rebecca"
Label: bug

Title: When opening multiple files Atom (1.3.0.beta0) creates a new window for each file
Body:
In Atom 1.2.0 when I opened a lot of files at once from the finder it was just adding them to a previously opened window. Now I'm trying the version 1.3.0.beta0 and it created a new window for each file, each of them having the folder the file was into as the project folder.

This is the result:

![](http://s24.postimg.org/t05v8vdlh/Screen_Shot_2015_11_13_at_17_27_14.png)

Every white rectangle is an Atom window, a crashed one. Is it a bug or a minded change? If so I'd like to point out that those files where all part of a folder that had already an Atom window, if you want to keep this "feature" at least you should notice it, and in that case attach them to the already opened window.
Label: bug

Title: permission error on fuse directories
Body:
I just upgraded to 1.2.0 and now I get a Permission error when trying to open anything, file or project, in my fuse directory.  In particular it is a directory mounted with objectivefs.  This did not happen on 1.1.0 or earlier.

Edit: I just verified it still works on 1.1.0

Atom 1.2.0
Ubuntu 12.04.5 LTS
apm  1.4.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.3
git 1.7.9.5
Label: bug

Title: Switching UI/Syntax theme does not display all elements in the new correct color
Body:
Repro steps from @damieng https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9550#issuecomment-322591908 

1. Install atom-ide-ui package
2. Open the diagnostics pane
3. Switch from One Light to One Dark or vice-versa
4. Observe wrong color for table column header

Actual part of the css is

```css
.nuclide-ui-table-header {
  font-weight: bold;
  background-color: @pane-item-background-color;
  border-bottom: 1px solid @base-border-color;
}
```

Where `@pane-item-background-color` is still resolving to the old value.

---

### UI theme

This can especially be seen when switching from white to black themes or reverse:
![themeswitching](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11130908/f63e6bf8-8987-11e5-9162-00a59b8124d8.PNG)
![themeswitching2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11131319/70b2a4ec-898a-11e5-94ce-19dd86b7d37b.PNG)

When restarting Atom the theme is correctly applied. However at least one package also often ignores a restart and show the wrong colour. This is:
- editor-stats as reported [here](https://github.com/atom/editor-stats/issues/28) already previously where this issue only was about this single addon

And FYI when switching back to the theme you switched from everything is displayed normally (or as before you switched - `editor-stats` still looks like it looked always)

This is similar to the issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8860 which was fixed before, but Atom does not show any warnings in the developer console.
### Syntax theme

I can also see this happening with the sytax theme. However here it only applies to `markdown-preview` (same issues as above; works when restarting Atom) and the editor seems to be changed correctly.
However when looking more carefully even here sometimes it does also not correctly change the font colour of a file (reproduced with a markdown file). When switching to a dark syntax theme the text stays grew. In this case also the global font setting is not applied correctly and does not change the font (note that it was correctly applied to a file opened after changing the theme).

One time it also did not changed the colour of the line numbers:
![linenumbers](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/11131689/2eeb2c6c-898c-11e5-9bf6-56956492bb67.PNG)

Atom 1.1.0
Windows 7
Label: bug

Title: copy/paste in native inputs no longer works
Body:
Hi,

Nuclide debugger uses chrome debugger UI as it front end UI. Atom seems to hijack the copy/paste operations which caused these operations to be disabled in Nuclide watch/console window. 

I think it is regressed in recent Atom releases per user reporting. 

Any idea how to fix this?

Jeffrey

Title: Unexpected folding behavior
Body:
If I follow these steps:
1. Fold Level 2
2. Open a single fold in code
3. Fold Level 3

I would expect that only the visible code to be folded at level 3. Currently Atom opens all folds and folds all code at level 3. This annoys me when I need to go through big files.

_Note: Sublime Text behaves as I'd expect_
Label: enhancement

Title: Activate core packages before activating third party packages
Body:
In package activation, `linter-*` is activated **before** `notifications` package. Which results in https://github.com/steelbrain/package-deps/issues/25
I have to work it around by waiting 20 ms before getting the view of the notification, see [this line](https://github.com/steelbrain/package-deps/pull/26/files#diff-2ee7035f560888fa5c0f1c0e929032fdR21)

It would be nice to have this issue resolved in the core instead of working it around in every package.
Label: enhancement

Title: Add more file extensions on OS X
Body:
Carried over from #9449. Currently Atom's `file` icon gets used for these file extensions: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/resources/mac/atom-Info.plist

Would be good to add at least all the languages that come bundled with Atom: https://github.com/atom/language-examples/tree/master/languages

I think these are missing:
- `clojure`
- `COMMIT_EDITMSG`
- `less`
- `mk`
- `mustache`
- `erb`
- `scss` + `sass`
- `toml`

![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 11 07 26 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/11081983/b9f5052c-8864-11e5-83b4-cce677e3779c.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: Change version number scheme for built versions
Body: So that version numbers sort in a more expected way, we should change the version numbers of built versions from `vX.Y.Z-dev-SHA` to `vX.Y.Z-alpha-SHA`.
Label: enhancement

Title: Add channel indicator to title bar
Body:
Currently the title bar has the following information:

```
<filename> - <path> - Atom
```

When running Beta or Alpha (custom-built) channels, there should be an indication of this in the title bar:

```
<filename> - <path> - Atom[ Alpha|Beta]
```
Label: enhancement

Title: Horizontal Scolling From Trackpad Treated Like Arrow Keys
Body:
When I use Horizontal Scrolling from my touchpad, Atom treats it like I am just pushing my left/right arrow keys, moving the cursor one character at a time left or right. Vertical Scrolling works great for me from my touchpad.

Behavior does not change with toggling the following settings:
- Scroll Past End
- Soft Wrap
- Soft Wrap At Preferred Line Length

OS: Windows 10 (this was happening on Windows 8.1 as well)
Atom Version: 1.1.0
Computer: Samsung ATIV Book 8
Touchpad: Elan Touchpad (ETDWare X64 15.7.0.1_WHQL)
Label: bug

Title: Switching desktops in OS X makes text cursor change to normal cursor (fullscreen mode).
Body:
![atombug1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2590174/11020375/80a5e8f6-861e-11e5-8ed8-64a86dc23b7a.gif)

When Atom is in fullscreen mode and you click on some text in Atom, you can see a text cursor. That's correct. But when you switch to other desktop, and then switch to Atom again, the cursor is not a text cursor. Even clicking on the text again doesn't change that. The only workaround is to move the cursor to some other widget, and then move it over text area again.

Title: Pressing Ctrl while the page is being inertially scrolled decreases the font size
Body:
I think it maybe only reproducible on a Mac. I'm using two-finger scroll on MBP, which has this 'inertia' effect, causing the page to slowly decelerate scrolling after two fingers were already lifted from the touch pad surface. So if I press Ctrl during the inertia scrolling (after I physically stopped dragging fingers onto the touch pad surface), - the font becomes tiny as if I pressed Ctrl + <minus> multiple times.

I'm using Atom 1.1.0 on OSX 10.10.5.
Label: bug

Title: Atom incorrectly detecting changes to files with changed line endings when git has core.autocrlf set
Body:
I'm having an issue where git on the command line doesn't report a file as changed, but Atom is showing the file as changed in the tree view.

Opening the file shows +22, -22 in the stats indicator in Atom, but doesn't show any individual line in the file as changed. (There are no bars indicating changed lines on the left.) If I change the file, the changed lines are shown as changed in the bars on the left, but no other lines in the file are shown as changed (as the stats indicator would have you believe).

Showing hidden characters lets me see that the line endings in the file are indeed different, but these changes are ignored by git, as per my settings.

Now here's something weird I discovered in the process of debugging this issue. This might actually be a bug in git...

``` text
$ git config core.autocrlf
input
$ git config --global core.autocrlf
$ git config --local core.autocrlf
$ git config --system core.autocrlf
```

git seems to think my `core.autocrlf` setting is set to "input", but I don't have it set to that anywhere in my settings. Why? I have no idea. Anyone know if this is a bug in git? And if so, where do I report it?

Setting `core.autocrlf` explicitly seems to resolve the inconsistency, causing Atom to once again ignore changes to line endings:

``` text
$ git config --global core.autocrlf input
```

This difference of behavior is confusing though. Is this a bug in Atom? Or perhaps a bug in git, git-utils, or maybe libgit2?

Note I'm running `git version 2.6.2.windows.1` on Windows 10, and Atom v1.1.0.

Note: _Issue migrated from akonwi/git-plus#302._
Label: bug

Title: Window menu doesn't list open windows
Body:
In Atom 1.2.0-beta0, OS X 10.11.1.

The “Window? menu is no longer listing the open Atom windows, making it difficult to switch between them. The problem still occurs in safe mode.

Title: Alt + Mouse Selection to select multiple lines

https://www.sublimetext.com/docs/2/column_selection.html

Would love to see that in Atom.
Label: enhancement

Title: Positioning Caret in CTL Text
Body:
Use this sample Hebrew (rtl)

```
כָּתֵף
```

Starting from the extreme left, I would expect a right arrow either to move the cursor to the next visual position (that is, between the ת and the ף) or jump to what is the next logical position (between the כ and the ת). Instead Atom doesn't move the cursor at all. Functionally however, it has moved between the כ and the dagesh (middle dot), similarly if I hit the right arrow again, the cursor stays at point 0 but logically it is now between the qamets (the vowel point beneath the כ) and the dagesh.

This gets interesting when you hit the right arrow a third time. The cursor now moves between the ת and the ף but logically it is actually between the כ and the ת and if you hit backspace, it will remove the qamets).

This issue reported from https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4007
Label: bug

Title: No keybinding for window:save-all on Windows and Linux
Body:
I use Atom on both a Mac and a Windows machine, and I tend to use the "Save All" function quite often on my Mac. Also, on Windows I am quite used to the shortcut Ctrl-Shift-S for "Save All" from Visual Studio, Notepad++, etc.

Any particular reason why there is no binding for window:save-all on Windows and Linux?
