Title: Change "Do you want to quit" buttons
Body:
Basically, this is quite annoying me. Whenever I go to quite an application the buttons are:

"Save", "Cancel", "Don't Save"

I am so used to having:

"Save", "Don't Save", "Cancel"

From switching from Text Sublime. This problem is slightly annoying as whenever I don't want to save, I end up clicking cancel and having to do the process again. 

Apologies if this has already been brought up!

![annoying](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/878780/6371609/6a03ad74-bcf5-11e4-8bfd-372e703c0608.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: Variable UI font-size
Body:
This issue acts as the "umbrella" for everything related to a variable UI font-size. Other related issues: https://github.com/atom/styleguide/pull/25, #4342, #3792,  https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/307, https://github.com/atom/atom-dark-ui/issues/24
#### Problem:

Unlike the Syntax font size, there isn't an easy way to change the font size for the UI.
#### Current options:

**1. Styles.less** Anything can be overridden in `styles.less`. Works great for tweaks in certain areas, but can't really be used to override all font sizes at once.

**2. Themes** Themes that are based on the `rem/em` units can be scaled by only changing the root element like `html { font-size: 14px; }`. To my knowledge, currently only [isotope-ui](https://atom.io/themes/isotope-ui) supports that.

**3. Zoom** It's possible to change the zoom level in `init.coffee`:

``` coffee
require('web-frame').setZoomFactor(2)
```

[See this discussion](https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-set-the-font-for-the-settings-ui-and-the-command-browser/13498/4). Works for all themes, but could have some px rounding issues.
#### Possible improvements (future):
1. Add a way to override Less variables from `styles.less`, themes and in the settings. There was an attempt but needs to be investigated further: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/4153#issuecomment-73980380 
2. Switch everything to `rem/em` based font units. But this won't happen for 1.0 since it might break existing themes, packages and people's `styles.less`. Maybe for 2.0 if overriding Less variables isn't possible till then.
Label: enhancement

Title: Files are scrolled to top when updated externally
Body:
steps to reproduce
1. open a log file in atom
2. scroll part way down the file
3. add new line to end of log file with an external tool/editor and save
4. go back and view the log file in atom

expected
- log file is reloaded
- log file scroll position is still part way down (same as in step 2 above)

actual
- log file is reloaded (PASS)
- log file scroll position goes back to top (FAIL)

Every time a new line is added externally the editor reloads it (as it should) but it jumps to the top which makes it impossible to read log files while they're been written because atom constantly jump back to the top.
Label: enhancement

Title: Using proxy server with Atom is very complex
Body:
You can configure Atom (OSX) to use a HTTP proxy as follows:
1. Add proxy info to APM:
   
   ```
   apm config set proxy http://localhost:9999
   apm config set http-proxy http://localhost:9999
   apm config set strict-ssl false # only add if needed - may be required if your proxy uses a non-globally-accepted SSL cert
   ```
2. Run `HTTP_PROXY="http://127.0.0.1:9999" HTTPS_PROXY="http://127.0.0.1:9999" atom --proxy-server="http://127.0.0.1:9999"`
3. You can now update Atom & packages/themes from within Atom.

(sidenote: git clones still won't work and require proxy configuration in `$HOME/.gitconfig` or `$HOME/.ssh/config`.)

This is reallllllly complex, and AFAICT not documented anywhere. I cobbled together this information from:
- atom/atom-shell#584
- atom/atom#1807 (very helpful)
- atom/atom-shell#183

This ticket is about the following issues:
- Atom needs proxy config specified three ways (should only need to specify this data in once)
- There's no documentation of this process (steps should be mentioned in the manual)
Label: enhancement

Title: Add selection above/below all the way
Body:
Keycodes `ctrl-alt-up/down` are linked to `editor:add-selection-above/below`, but is there also an editor command to add the selection above/below on all the lines all the way to the top/bottom? I've tried `ctrl-alt-pgup/pgdn/home/end` and had a look in the command pallette (`ctrl-shift-p`) but haven't found it.

[see also](https://discuss.atom.io/t/add-selection-above-below-all-the-way/14245)
Label: enhancement

Title: Ctrl-shift-right at end of line doesn’t select EOL and next line whitespace up to first word
Body:
I expect that a ctrl-shift-right with the cursor at the end of the line, selects the end-of-line and the white-space at the beginning of the next line, but it doesn't.

[see also](https://discuss.atom.io/t/ctrl-right-at-end-of-line-doesnt-select-eol-and-next-line-whitespace-up-to-first-word/14889)
Label: enhancement

Title: Opening and closing Uncaught error stack trace results in duplication
Body:
When an uncaught exception occurs opening and closing the stack trace results in the "Open stack trace", "Close stack trace" labels being duplicated.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1090602/6348858/dc518e30-bc1b-11e4-867d-d691d3ce3788.PNG)
Label: bug

Title: Opening a file in an existing window shouldn't add a project path
Body: Right now, if I run `atom some-directory` then `atom another-directory/some-file.txt`, the directory `another-directory` is added to the project as a new root directory. This is wrong.
Label: bug

Title: Open-Apple F should allow you to search packages list when viewing installed packages
Body:
I went to the packages list, looking to change a particular packages setting, and expected Command-F to allow me to search the list (thinking it was just an Atom view). Turns out that's not the case (I had to click into the search filter box, despite the native search dialog popping up).

It'd be awesome if either native search worked, or hitting Command-F hijacked the native functionality and dropped me in the filter dialog when listing installed plugins.
Label: enhancement

Title: Follow shortcut links (*.lnk) on Windows
Body:
Atom should support following the shortcuts/"shell links" Windows uses.
Currently when dragging a file to Atom, or when selecting a shortcut in the tree view, the binary file is opened directly. ([format ![msdn](http://bits.wikimedia.org/static-1.25wmf17/skins/Vector/images/external-link-ltr-icon.png?2015-02-11T19:35:00Z)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd891294.aspx))

Title: nextAction called even in case of error
Body:
This contradicts the comment:

```
# * `nextAction` (optional) {Function} which will be called after the item is
#   successfully saved.
```

The call should probably be in the `else` clause of the `try` block, if CS supported that.

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/dcbff35ef5dce9b69fdb7f6dd485dbdd6d22d6fe/src/pane.coffee#L488
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/dcbff35ef5dce9b69fdb7f6dd485dbdd6d22d6fe/src/pane.coffee#L508

Title: Restart and Update Doesn't from Release Notes Page
Body:
Using the Restart and Update button on the release notes view doesn't properly restart and update. Atom closes, but it never restarts. When launched again, it hasn't updated. Restart and update from the Atom Menu works fine.

2010 iMac, OSX 10.10.2
Label: bug

Title: language-lua should be installed by default
Body:
Many other programming languages are supported out-of-the-box, but not Lua.
This led me to think for a moment that there is no syntax highlighting in Atom.

Please include language-lua package in core in future versions.
Thanks in advance.
Label: enhancement

Title: apm upgrade broken in linux deb
Body:
```
$ apm upgrade
Could not determine current Atom version installed
$ atom --version
61fff23
```

Version is 0.182.0 but I believe this broke with the switch to iojs.
Label: bug

Title: 'core:copy' does not work when it is assigned to another key
Body:
I want to copy text and keep it in buffer. But 'core:copy' delete text from buffer.

Atom: 0.182.0
OS: Ubuntu 14.04
1. Change keymap

```
# keymap.cson
'atom-workspace':
  'y': 'core:copy'
```
1. Run Atom with safe option.

```
$ atom --safe
```
1. Input "foobar" and select all.

buffer:

```
foobar
```
1. Press "y" key (I want to copy "foobar" and **keep text in buffer**) .

buffer: 

```
y
```

Note: `ctrl-*` key mapping works well.

```
# keymap.cson
'atom-workspace':
  'ctrl-y': 'core:copy' # work!
```
Label: bug

Title: Different character widths in OS X and Linux
Body:
Using Atom 0.182.0 in OS X and Mint 16 produces different results for the same file. In the screenshots below, the top figure is on the linux version and the bottom is in OS X. The width of the non-breaking hyphen (‑) differs, as you can see from the alignment towards the end of that row.

![screenshot from 2015-02-20 12 27 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4955347/6308803/3b65c382-b8fc-11e4-9a95-e0386dae09a7.png)

![screen shot 2015-02-20 at 12 27 19 pmaaaaa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4955347/6308909/1e97ce48-b8fd-11e4-9e70-f61303a3ec65.png)

The font for both of these is Source Code Pro. The bottom figure is clearly the desired behavior.

I am pretty sure the linux behavior, where this character is more narrow than all others, was present in the OS X version until recently, but I just noticed that it changed today.
Label: bug

Title: Can not start atom on Windows 7
Body:
I just donwloaded atom and installed and an exception appears:

![captura](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/6283129/14d8f926-b8e0-11e4-8bda-ece442bdcaf9.PNG)

I have the same problem in safe mode
Label: bug

Title: Copy paste of text aligned with spaces (e.g. asterisk-aligned PHPDoc) sometimes loses the alignment with soft tabs off
Body:
Easiest to reproduce with PHP grammar, and the "doc_f" snippet. Soft tabs needs to be off (it's fine with it on.)

Create a new PHP file and use doc_f snippet. You'll get a PHPDoc block which uses the recommended formatting - the asterisks are aligned vertically using an additional leading space.

When copy and pasting... this space is lost if you paste on an already indented line. ANIGIF below shows the reproduction, and shows that on an empty line it pastes OK, but on pasting with indentation the spaces aligning the asterisks are lost.

![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/939815/6273202/41e81dbe-b865-11e4-8ea5-a5354bdbb50c.gif)

In case someone thinks aligning the asterisks is bad practice - it's actually customary for PHPDoc. See first glossary entry on the PHPDoc website:
http://www.phpdoc.org/docs/latest/glossary.html

**Edit: Removed the root cause bit - I've put it in the PR**

Thanks!
Label: bug

Title: Cursor doesn't fully cover hard tabs, but only the first space of a tab
Body:

Desired: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2461183/56305ce6-af74-11e3-985a-ddc437efae2a.png)

I'm tagging this as a feature request -- I think that even vim covers only the first space?

Title: New window command creates new file when window has no project path
Body:
In 0.181.0 on OS X. Steps to reproduce:
1. `atom --safe`
2. `cmd-shift-n`
3. `cmd-shift-n` in the new window. A new file is created instead.

If you then open an existing file in the new window, giving it a project path, the new window command starts working again.
Label: bug

Title: join-lines should do the right thing when lines have a prefix (e.g. # or // comments)
Label: enhancement

Title: Usability with git rebase, amend, etc
Body:
I have been using atom as my default editor when using git. One productivity issue I have is with the `--wait` command where you have to close the entire atom instance for waiting to be done. I know this sounds normal but when rebasing the atom instance needs to opened and closed many times and the load times on windows leave some time for thumb twiddling. My window load time is around 3-4 seconds.

It would be hot if atom could trigger the `--wait` completion when the tab is closed. I believe this is the behavior in sublime text. 

_My cursory search for this topic didn't show any results._
Label: enhancement

Title: Tree-view is broken on Windows 8.1 since 0.180.0
Body:
Since Atom updated to 0.180.0 my tree-view only shows the content of the atom folder instead of the project/folder opened (see screenshot below). Opening a new folder does not help, tree-view still shows the content of the atom folder. 
I tried reinstalling Atom and i even removed all configuration etc that were left behind. For one session its fine, after restart of Atom is shows the wrong content again. I use Windows 8.1 as OS. 
Thanks for looking into it! 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10849280/6253730/dea37df0-b7a3-11e4-863f-4d596f345636.png)
Label: bug

Title: Open Folder always creates a new window (Atom 0.180.0)
Body:
In Atom 0.180.0, if you go to `File -> Open Folder`, Atom always creates a new window, even if there isn't a folder for the current window.

To explain further, to open a folder:
- Open window one (with no folder/project specified)
- Click "Open Folder" on window one
- Window two opens
- Close window one
- Switch back to window two and start working

This is in contrast to the previous method which would add folders to the current window if none were already added.

I was able to replicate in safe mode.
Windows 7 x64
Atom 0.180.0
Label: bug

Title: package names versus folder names
Body:
I get quite confused when packages use names in their repo like `atom-my-package` when the Atom package name is actually `my-package`.  I end up renaming folders several times to clone a repo, work on it, and do a PR.

Enough bitching and on to the problem.  When I had  the `atom-my-package` folder in `~/.atom/packages` then the package listed in settings was`atom-my-package`.  But the settings were saved under  `my-package` which is what was in `package.json`.  So settings didn't work until I renamed the folder `my-package`.

All code in atom should use the package name in `package.json` or they should all use the folder name containing package.json.  Right now they are not consistent.
Label: enhancement

Title: Untitled file Version 0.180.0
Body:
My Atom installation got updated to 0.180 today. I noticed an issue.  

When you start this version, it opens an "Untitled" file automatically. Now, you close Atom without editing anything at all. Open Atom again, now you will see 2 "Untitled" files. Close again and reopen, you will see 3 Untitled files. Looks like Atom keeps on adding more Untitled files if you exit without closing them.

Other issues as and when reported will be reported. Oh by the way, I like this editor better than Brackets for some reason :)

Thanks
Sudharshan

looking at the api, I would like to create an app to search themes and display them. The api endpoints are there, but I cannot consume them via ajax because of CORS.

Can you add a https://atom.io/crossdomain.xml to allow access?

Title: Atom fails silently when package.json "main" points to non-exsistant file
Body:
Atom v-0.180.0
Ubuntu 14.04

See the last half of the discussion at #5492. Here are the highlights:
- git clone an atom package locally
- change package.json "main" field to a non-exsistant file
- run apm install to bring in node_modules
- run apm link
- open atom

In the settings view, you will see the package under the `community packages` section. You can play with the settings and all activation commands are available. However, dispatching one of these commands silently fails with no output to the dev tools and as a side effect removes all of the package's activation commands from the command pallete. As further debugging you can reset atom and open the dev tools then:
- atom.packages.resolvePackagePath('my-package') => returns 'path/to/local/repo'
- atom.packages.activatePackage('my-package') => returns an object
- atom.packages.isPackageActive('my-package') => returns false

cc @kevinsawicki @thedaniel
Label: bug

Title: Moving the window of an unsaved tab should not prompt to save the document
Body: Say you have two atom windows open. In one of the windows you have a tab with unsaved content. Right if you drag that tab from one atom window to the other, atom will prompt you to save the file. There's no reason for it to do this, the file's not being closed, nothing is being lost.
Label: bug

Title: Title bar is not appropriate for non-project files
Body:
When a project is open (i.e. the file browser is open), if I open the LICENSE or other non-project file, then the title bar will show like:

> LICENSE -- /path/to/project

This is misleading because it implies that the `LICENSE` file is inside the /path/to/project when it is not. In fact... I have no idea where the hell LICENSE is. It would be better to have something else in the title bar. Recommendations are:
- `LICENSE`
- `Atom - LICENSE`
- `Atom - Version 0.179.0 - LICENSE`

Now, for example, when I open "Open your Config", the titlebar shows `config.cson -- /path/to/project`, I am unsure if this is a global config file or if the file is actually saved at /path/to/project/config.cson.

![screen shot 2015-02-17 at 10 23 46 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/382183/6230650/5197078e-b68f-11e4-9a82-a5b7b92aa02f.png)

![screen shot 2015-02-17 at 10 22 36 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/382183/6230652/546984be-b68f-11e4-808a-7d8747361fff.png)
Label: bug

Title: Package gets duplicated when moved to Atom Core Packages
Body:
Original post here: https://discuss.atom.io/t/language-csharp-package-appears-twice/14867

**Language-csharp package appears twice**

After the [recent 0.178.0 release](https://atom.io/releases) (_Atom now includes C# syntax highlighting by default_), the language-csharp package appears twice in my "Installed Package" list - once under Community Packages, and once under Core Packages.

![fa75766fb9ca7157](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/517857/6182518/c6de7932-b388-11e4-8b62-4ff64ac6275c.png)

I manually disabled the Community Packages version, but there is no option to uninstall it.

I was able to manually delete the Community Packages version in `~/.atom/packages/languages-csharp` via command line, which is a temporary workaround to the problem.

Ideally, when a package is moved to Atom Core, the existing Community Package is uninstalled and settings are transferred to the Atom Core version.

Additional info: OS X 10.10.2, Atom 0.177.0/0.178.0

Thanks. :sparkles:
Label: bug

Title: Deprecations in Tasks aren't reported
Body: If you have code running inside a `Task` handler, then any deprecations encountered in there won't be reported to deprecation cop since they happen out of process.
Label: bug

Title: Saving message would be nice
Body:
When I use Atom with mounted (S)FTP disks that are slow and I save the editor is not responsive until the file is saved. Would be nice to have a notification or something that tells me that the file is still saving.

Thanks
Label: enhancement

Title: Ability to see the warning when build aborts
Body: It would be very useful for a user and probably to help debug for you guys to have the Warnings display in the terminal instead of just saying "Aborted due to warnings.". I then have to modify my build script to use `-v` so I can see the warning.
Label: enhancement

Title: Using atom-text-editor in packages
Body:
For reference I've made a package to display all the standalone `atom-text-editor` permutations. https://github.com/atom/atom-text-editor-exercise

Currently using an `atom-text-editor` in a package as a replacement for `textarea` isnt that great:

``` html
<atom-text-editor>
    This editor
    grows
</atom-text-editor>
```

Produces:

![screen shot 2015-02-11 at 12 10 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/6155298/f5821de6-b1e6-11e4-9e7d-0e58eb069536.png)

A few issues
- It shows line numbers by default
- it shows invisibles if I have them enabled
- It grows by default
- The styling is not like the mini editors

Constraining height makes it behave a little more like a text area, but you need to set the height in the `style` attribute or the editor does weird things:

``` html
<atom-text-editor style="height: 100px">
  Some text
</atom-text-editor>
```

Produces (border added for clarity)

![screen shot 2015-02-11 at 12 14 43 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/6155366/98817a14-b1e7-11e4-81ce-10000d915e8f.png)

Also not great. It introduces something that is nice in the pane-item editor, but not in a textarea: you cant get close to the bottom of the editor with the cursor, there is always a 3 line padding. 

![editor-padding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/6155421/1c83812c-b1e8-11e4-91ca-8bd62c44999f.gif)
### Proposal

I propose two new tags:
- `atom-text-area`: textarea emulation. This would be an editor that
  - does not show invisibles
  - does not show the gutter
  - does not have the 3 line padding 
  - does not grow by default
  - allows the themes to style the editor as a text area
- `atom-text-input`: a replacement for the mini editors

Then we could add attributes to enable things
- `show-gutters` would show the gutter
- `auto-height` would ignore css sizing
- `read-only` would set to read only instead of the remove `tabindex` hack 

The markdown preview can just use the `atom-text-editor` to get full code support.
Label: enhancement

Title: ATOM_HOME does not affect default Chromium storage path
Body:
hi

i'm on Win7 64bit and downloaded the newest
atom-windows.zip version 0.178.0 from
https://github.com/atom/atom/releases
to test the new ATOM_HOME env var feature.

i've set the env var ATOM_HOME to the path
D:\portable_programs\Atom\ATOM_HOME
and started atom.exe .
now in the folder
D:\portable_programs\Atom\ATOM_HOME
appeared only one dir "compile-cache" and
only one file "config.cson". it looks like
an incomplete part of the files and folders
that would normally be created on the first run
of atom.exe in the folder
C:\Users\ <user> \.atom
the content of "config.cson" looks different
than usual and contains the line
"exception-reporting"

the folder
C:\Users\ <user> \AppData\Roaming\Atom
was created in the same place, like without
a present ATOM_HOME env var. so for the folder
C:\Users\ <user> \AppData\Roaming\Atom
the redirection via ATOM_HOME does not
work in the actual Atom version 0.178.0 .

for the folder
C:\Users\ <user> \.atom
the redirection via ATOM_HOME env var
works partially and the files
.gitignore , init.coffee , keymap.cson ,
snippets.cson and styles.less and the
folder packages were not created, when
ATOM_HOME was set.

also i would expect that the files and folders of
C:\Users\ <user> \.atom
would be placed in the ATOM_HOME env var mode
in the same subfolder .atom like
<path in ATOM_HOME> \.atom
but they landed directly in
<path in ATOM_HOME> \
Label: enhancement

Title: Icons missing for theme using atom:// protocol
Body:
Some of the icons that I'm using seem to be missing when using the ATOM_HOME variable in my shell.

The theme doesn't seem to be the issue, it seems to be the way Atom is routing requests coming from the atom:// protocol.

I get the following errors in the console:

```
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND    atom://seti-ui/stylesheets/_fonts/icomoon.woff 
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND    atom://seti-ui/stylesheets/_fonts/icomoon.ttf
```

Looking through the code, I found [this line](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/44112f2ecd54eebe7496d1b581cac182e46ab0df/src/browser/atom-protocol-handler.coffee#L21) that may be pointing to the wrong directory, or rather, not respecting the ATOM_HOME variable.

Atom: 0.178.0
OS: Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.2
Label: bug

Title: Can't update or install any packages without root permission
Body:
- Ubuntu 14.04
- Atom 0.178.0
- apm 0.136.0

It is impossible for me to update or install any packages from the atom ui. I get an error message like this:
![atom-update-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9311295/6141355/2a450964-b172-11e4-9780-d67ed56741e5.png)

apm gives the same error on the command line, unless sudo is used. In which case it works fine. On a possibly related note, packages linked via `apm link --dev` show up in the installed packages view like they should, but are not activateable.
Label: bug

Title: Inserting control characters
Body:
To insert a control character:
- In GNU Emacs, I can precede the combination with `C-q` (`quoted-insert`).
- In Vim, I can precede the combination with `C-v`.
- In GNU nano, I can precede the combination with `M-v`.

But AFAIK there is no way to insert (and display, see #1839) control characters in Atom. The [GCS](https://www.gnu.org/prep/standards/standards.html#index-formfeed) uses formfeed characters (control-L) to divide programs into pages at logical places, but I have to use other editors to do the insertion.
Label: enhancement

Title: Round trip write/read of string in UTF-8 encoding doesn't match
Body:
In my Atom package I do: ``` activate: (state) -> p = "/tmp/encodiningtext.txt" text = "
  • ê
    • " console.log text fs.writeFileSync(p, text, { encoding: 'utf8' }) console.log fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8') ``` And the console output is: ```
  • ê
  • �
    • ``` https://discuss.atom.io/t/file-encoding-puzzel/14828
Label: bug

Title: Scroll past end no longer work
Body:
I'm currently running Atom 0.178.0-89d5dd3 and the `Scroll Past End` setting is no longer effective. 
Deactivating and reactivating the setting doesn't do much.

I think the change occurred in the past few days.

OS: OSX 10.10.2
Label: bug

Title: Tooltip "discovery" mode
Label: enhancement

Title: Auto indent on paste behaves oddly with already indented lines.
Body:
When copying a segment of code that starts with a new-line followed by tabbed-in code while "Auto Indent On Paste" is enabled, consecutive pastes will each be an additional tab deeper. I tested this with C++, Java, and JavaScript which makes me believe it is not a problem with the language specs.

Here is an example in the form of an animated gif:
![autoindent-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/466761/6118758/d4ce2e04-b075-11e4-864b-46726fcd809e.gif)

It isn't just comments that this happens with, but it does require the previous line to be selected. Specifically, this happens when the copy-buffer matches a regex like `/^\n\s+[^\s]/`. That is, it starts with a newline, followed by one or more whitespace characters and then a non-whitespace character. And the previous line must be a blank line.
Label: bug

Title: Overlay decorations don't overflow out of the editor
Body:
It would be nice if overlay decorations could be positioned outside of the editor, such as for autocomplete. With additional type information, it would be great if we could keep suggestions lined up with what the user is typing.

![screen shot 2015-02-06 at 5 08 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/136982/6114867/24a7bf46-b06f-11e4-8bcf-d6327d6a539a.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: A lot of key-bindings are NOT shown in the menu
Body: I miss a lot of key-bindings shown in the menu - maybe there is a way to read the original keymappings and show them in menue.
Label: bug

Title: .atomrc?
Body:
Wondering if it would be easier to have an `~.atomrc` file instead of the 5 config files and extra folders in `~/.atom`. Could be easier to sync and keep in git perhaps. Open Atom, give it a gist or repo URL with your `.atomrc` file in it. :boom: 

On second thought, I guess customization would become a lot harder if the `.atomrc` route was taken. Maybe just keeping those 5 config files separate would be a good solution? Not sure of the feasibility or repercussions.
Label: enhancement

Title: Feature request: "Really close?" popup keyboard shortcuts
Body:
When I close an unsaved file, I get a popup saying "foo has changes, do you want to save them?".  The popup has three buttons "Save", "Cancel" and "Don't Save".

The standard Windows dialog for this allows me to hit n to select Don't Save.

WIBNI Atom would allow me to do the same, at least on Windows?
Label: enhancement

Title: I can't run fcitx on Atom
Body:
atom version:0.177.0
archLinux: x86_64
fcitx version: 4.2.8.5

I can use fcitx in Chrome/Chromium.But I cannot type Chinese in atom of this version.
Label: bug

Title: Cannot delete files from mounted volume
Body:
Hi. I have faced a problem deleting a files located on a folder mounted through the sshfs. Atom wants to move files to trash and it is, obviously, not possible. 
Is there an option to enable permanent deleting when moving to trash is unavailable or just force to delete permanently every time.
Thanks.
Label: bug

Title: Man pages for atom and apm
Body:
Besides the `--help` and `-h` command line options/arguments, `atom` and `apm` should also have man pages. Moreover, Emacs and Vim have online documentation for their command line arguments and/or environment variables, too:
- http://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/emacs/Emacs-Invocation.html#Emacs-Invocation
- http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/starting.html#vim-arguments
Label: enhancement

Title: Unable to update Atom on Linux using Master
Body:
I am unable to update Atom to the latest commit on `master`.

**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04
**Atom:** master branch (83c8d904cf)

It seems to fail on the `install` task

``` console
$ sudo script/grunt install
```

When running in verbose mode:

``` console
$ sudo script/grunt install -v
...
Writing /usr/local/share/atom/version...OK
Copied /tmp/atom-build/Atom to /usr/local/share/atom.
Reading package.json...OK
Parsing package.json...OK
Warning: executable is not defined Use --force to continue.

Aborted due to warnings.
```

When building from the latest tag, there is no issue.
Label: bug

Title: About Input Method Editor and `onDidChange`
Body:
Please take a look at this issue first: https://github.com/atom-community/autocomplete-plus/pull/244.

I noticed that when typing with IME, Atom fires `onDidChange` on each keypress, but it's a performance waste. Because of IME only transform characters into REAL words when `enter` or `whitespace` is hit. Before that, editor should do nothing. 

I suggest:
- If `compositionstart` fired, stop sending `onDidChange`
- If `compositionend` fired, send `onDidChange` with new values
- Add events for CompositionEvents, e.g. `onCompositionStart`

More info about `CompositionEvents`: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CompositionEvent .
Label: enhancement

Title: About transposing two characters at the end of a line
Body:
In Emacs, one can use `C-t` (`transpose-chars`) to transpose two adjacent characters. Normally, `C-t` transposes the two characters on either side of point (the place in the buffer at which insertion and deletion occur). When given at the end of a line, rather than transposing the last character of the line with the newline, which would be useless, `C-t` transposes the last two characters on the line. So, if you catch your transposition error right away, you can fix it with just a `C-t`. If you don't catch it so fast, you must move the cursor back between the two transposed characters before you type `C-t`.

In Atom, `ctrl-t`   (`editor:transpose`) always transpose two adjacent characters, wherever they are. Will Atom change this behavior?
Label: enhancement

Title: Unable to use <enter> to go to new line after file dragged to different panel.
Body:
Atom Version: 0.174.0
OS: OSX Mavericks

When I create a new panel and then drag an already open file from the existing panel to the new panel, I can no longer create a new line by pressing `<enter>`, but I can create a new line by using `<command>` + `<enter>`.

This only seems to happen when the file is dragged over. The initial file which started the panel, as well as any files that are opened in the panel work fine.

There are no console errors when pressing `<enter>`.
Label: bug

Title: Files deleted outside atom should be closed in atom
Body:
When I delete a file in my project which is already opened, atom is still showing the contents of the deleted file in my editor tab. Surprisingly I can apply changes to it and save the file without any warning message.
In In this case Atom behaves like the file would still exist. Actually he's now editing the same file in my trash folder which is confusing.

I would assume that the editor tab of the deleted is either closed, or when saving it, atom should tell me that this file does not exist anymore and I should save it to a new location.

Title: Built-in documentation?
Body:
Many editors have built-in documentation. For example, the `C-h` prefix in Emacs, `:help` in Vim, and `^G` in nano. Moreover, many of them also include a tutorial for new users (`:!vimtutor` in Vim and `help-with-tutorial` in Emacs, for example). But for Atom, I only found the `welcome` package.

Is there any plan for built-in documentation in Atom?
Label: enhancement

Title: Atom on Chromebook?
Body: Have you talked about bringing Atom to the world of Chromebooks as a packaged app or something? Any thoughts on that?
Label: enhancement

Title: Some suggestions to CONTRIBUTING.md
Body:
I have a few suggestions to CONTRIBUTING.md. Here are some items that can be added:
- A brief introduction to the workflow (or at least link to help.github.com)
- Web QA (find problems of atom.io across a variety of platforms and browsers)
- Atom QA (find bugs in Atom, Atom Shell, apm, and official Atom packages)
- Translation (I'm not sure whether/when Atom and/or atom.io will support languages other than English, though)
- Something like Mozilla's "Good First Bugs" and "Mentored Bugs"
- Contribute to Atom Wiki, perhaps. (See https://discuss.atom.io/t/a-multilingual-wiki-for-atom/14640)

Also, coding opportunities can be classified to languages/technologies. For example:
- CoffeeScript/JavaScript (Atom and its core packages)
- C++ (Atom Shell)
- Node.js
- CSS/Less (syntax/UI themes)
- Jasmine (spec)
- HTML
- Shell script (e.g., some scripts in `script/`, `atom.sh`, package CI scripts etc.)
Label: enhancement

Title: Javascript comment indentation
Body:
When auto indenting JS comment blocks, 

```js
/**
 *
 */
```

becomes:

```js
/**
*
*/
```

Since the first version is a pretty common comment block pattern (used in JSDoc and YUIDoc and similar projects), it'd be great if the auto indent feature could support this indentation instead of messing with it.
Label: bug

Title: Smooth scrolling (Linux)
Body:
I've seen some work in improving the smoothness of scrolling so far. But I'm wondering if it's actually possible to get real smooth scrolling or at least if it's planned for the near future?
Just reducing the scroll sensitivity to 1 line at a time is not a real solution...

Title: Tab switching (ctrl-tab) should be in MRU order
Body:
Current switching order is as tab display order, which is useless when opening many tabs.
Other editors uses MRU order to improve it (Intellij IDEA, Sublimetext, VS.net, Windows alt-tab etc..)

It's better to popup an open file list (in MRU order) when do switching (like IntelliJ IDEA / Windows alt-tab does).
![tabswitch_2366](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8944061/5994796/bde21f52-aabc-11e4-887e-bf7c41b61071.png)

**Actual:** When I click View > Panes, I see no keybindings even though the Panes operations have keybindings by default.

Title: Fix atom.open pathsToOpen option to accept a string
Body: For `atom.open` I passed in a plain string (rather than `[string]`) for the `pathsToOpen` option. It then tried to open a new window for each char in the string as a path (total pain). An easily fixed mistake on my end, but still painful. Possibly add array check?
Label: bug

Title: Disabling a package that provides shadow DOM scoped styles trashes all editor styles
Body:
1. Install a package that provides shadow DOM scoped styles for `atom-text-editor`. A minimal example is my [pulsing cursor package](https://github.com/dmnd/pulsing-cursor)
2. Activate the pulsing cursor
3. Open a file
4. Open a split pane (not sure if this is necessary to repro but it's what I did)
5. Open settings in the other pane and disable pulsing cursor
6. The editor that had the file open is now missing styles

Probably disabling the package removes all `atom-text-editor` styles instead of just [the ones provided by the package](https://github.com/dmnd/pulsing-cursor/blob/master/stylesheets/pulsing-cursor.atom-text-editor.less). If you enable the package again, the editor will be restored.
Label: bug

Title: grep support
Body:
I want something akin to `M-x grep` in emacs. The native find functionality isn't doing it for me.

I want to pass grep things like `--include` and the whole slimy cohort, then step through the results as in `build-tools-cpp`.

I can't find this functionality in atom or in any packages. Am I just missing it?
Label: enhancement

Title: Atom keeps adding desktop shortcut
Body:
Atom keeps recreating its desktop shortcut unexpectedly. I'm guessing it's something involved in the automatic update process, since it doesn't happen all the time. Creating a desktop shortcut on initial installation makes sense, but doing it every time a background update occurs does not.

I'm using Atom 0.176.0 on Windows 8.1 x64.

Title: atom.config.get '<some-color>' doesn't return an instance of Color if set in config.cson
Body:
When I try to `get` a config value of a setting with the `color` type, and the setting is saved to `config.cson` (so not the default value), I don't get an instance of the `Color` class, but rather just the object/string that was in `config.cson`.

Versions:
Atom: `0.176.0`
OS: Linux Debian 8 (testing)
Label: bug

Title: Find and Replace All in a project doesn't add the file changed icon in the sidebar until you view that file
Body:
If you use Find and Replace All to make changes in files in the project which aren't currently open, the sidebar won't show that the file has changed until you click to open and view the file.

**What should happen** - The sidebar should show that the file has changed, or open all those files in the editor with the changes. Sublime does this and leaves them unsaved, forcing the User to Save All.
Label: enhancement

Title: Ability to set syntax via the command palette
Body:
Sublime Text has the ability to set the syntax of your file using the command palette.  It has a command called "Set Syntax" that will switch the syntax of the currently opened document.

The Sublime Text web page has an example of it in action where the user types "sspy" to fuzzy find the command "Set Syntax: Python".

The only way to open the syntax menu in Atom seems to be clicking the current syntax in the bottom-right corner of the window.  There doesn't seem to be any keybind or command to open that window.
Label: enhancement

Title: Windows: "Paul Betts" folder appears in Start Menu
Body:
I'm on Windows 7. I updated Atom from 0.175.0 to 0.176.0 yesterday. Today, I noticed a new folder in my Start Menu Programs called "Paul Betts". The folder is empty. The creation time is just 13 seconds after the creation of the folder atom/app-0.176.0/resources and before the creation time of the rest of the files in atom/app-0.176.0.

This seems like a bug. In case it's relevant, I do remember closing Atom during the update process.
Label: bug

Title: Editor styles break on theme update
Body:
When performing a theme update in 0.175 of Atom for Windows, the tab interface shrunk down and wasn't clickable during the update.

It doesn't happen when on the install page of Settings. I also don't currently have another package to update at the moment to test if this is specifically seen with the theme i am using or if it is an Atom issue.

Is this normal behavior during updates though? I Also noticed that the package buttons to update, uninstall, or settings also expand during the update.
Label: bug

Title: ctrl-q quits atom without prompting to save modified files
Body: With such a keybinding, it is far too easy to lose work, i.e. when hitting it accidentally, or when slipping from a similar keybinding. This happenned to me few times now when I wanted to reflow selection (default keybinding ctrl-alt-q) but instead, I ended up with atom closed and work lost.
Label: bug

Title: Delay onDidChange for string types.
Body: I have a situation where I need to ensure  the user inputs a string in a specific format. I thought it would be nice to do some regex on the config string and format it accordingly. Furthermore it would feel a lot cleaner if I could do this using the onDidChange method. I gave it a shot but Atom froze up and when it didn't the change was instant and trying something was impossible. I would like to request a feature that delays the process until the settings window is closed to execute the callback.
Label: enhancement

Title: Partial selection is left behind
Label: bug

Title: Specific pane manipulation prevents panes from being deleted.
Body:
Atom 0.175.0
Mac OSX 10.10.1

When I split Panes in a window-like fashion.... Image 1

```
panes = atom.workspace.getPanes()
panes[0].splitDown()
panes[0].splitRight()
panes = atom.workspace.getPanes()
panes[2].splitRight()
```

Then open a untitled document in the 4th window.... Image 2

Then add and remove Panes until it changes to a horizontal layout.... Image 3

```
for pane in atom.workspace.getPanes()
  pane.destroy() if pane.getItems().length is 0
```

Then I can no longer remove Panes.... Image 4

Will continue to investigate incase this is a fault on my behalf.

---

For further details on pane manipulation: https://github.com/chemoish/atom-pane-layout

![screen shot 2015-01-23 at 7 45 28 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/549319/5886035/d11cdec6-a338-11e4-9cc1-b3ab0e56c750.png)
![screen shot 2015-01-23 at 7 45 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/549319/5886036/d3614b68-a338-11e4-8566-e795f3f4de74.png)
![screen shot 2015-01-23 at 7 45 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/549319/5886037/d7bec668-a338-11e4-9410-562afeea7b1c.png)
![screen shot 2015-01-23 at 7 45 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/549319/5886038/db8d2bfe-a338-11e4-8eb8-64ed195e2430.png)
Label: bug

Title: package upgrade failure stops all following upgrades
Body:
I have 11 packages waiting to be upgraded.  My first one is throwing an exception and the whole process dies.  This means until I solve the problem with the first one all others will have to wait.

I will uninstall the offending package for now but this should be fixed.
Label: enhancement

Title: Feature Request: Make package updates automatically happen in the background
Body:
Since I don't need to visit the settings page often, I often find my packages out of date. Automatic package updates in the background will ensure that.

I would recommend this by default, but there should at the very least be a setting to opt-in.
Label: enhancement

Title: Patch not replacing file associations (Windows 8.1 x64)
Body: Whenever Atom updates, opening a file associated with Atom will open only the old version. The updated Atom is in a different folder, and I have to delete the old folder and re-associate. Is there a way to fix this, and delete the previous installation of Atom after an update?
Label: bug

Title: Select menu flashes white when opening and closing in settings-view (Linux and Windows)
Body:
(I'm opening this here instead of in [settings-view](https://github.com/atom/settings-view) because I suspect this is a bigger issue than just settings-view.)

**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
**Atom:** 0.175.0

Whenever you you open or close a `select` in Settings it briefly flashes white, which can be kind of jarring. I've never experienced this on my Mac running Yosemite, so I suspect it's a Linux issue (which I can find out for sure when I go home and test on my VMs). This happens regardless of theme and in safe mode as well.

![screencast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/823545/5865577/896c8a62-a258-11e4-9024-b950627cea1e.gif)
Label: bug

Title: Add about the team page to atom.io
Body:
I would like to see an "about us" page on atom.io.  It should have a photo and short bio for every core team member along with primary responsibilities.  Many consider these public relations junk but I for one would like to see faces on the people that have such a big impact on Atom.  I think this would put a human face on the project and make it more welcoming.

Also a brief history of Atom, motivation for creating Atom, and a vision for the future would be nice.

Normally on an open-source project it would be hard to pick out contributors to be considered "core" but here it would be any github employee assigned to Atom.
Label: enhancement

Title: Can not open atom from command line
Body:
When I try to open atom from the command line using: atom .
I get this error
FSPathMakeRef(/Applications/Atom.app) failed with error -43.

I reinstalled the shell commands, closed and opened Atom, closed and opened the command prompt and the error still persists.
Label: bug

Title: Package config schemas aren't used at startup
Body:
- With Atom closed, add the following to your `~/.atom/config.cson` file:

``` coffee
'markdown-preview':
  liveUpdate: 4
```
- Open Atom
- Run `atom.config.get('markdown-preview.liveUpdate')` from the Console
- `4` is printed out

This schema for this package states this key path should be a boolean, https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/blob/dfc0f9617dc42885ec719134931c78293d275524/lib/main.coffee#L26-L28 but no validation error is logged at startup.
Label: bug

Title: Folder search result is not displayed
Body:
Although a Message (x) Results present is shown the search results are not shown. This is after the latest update. 
![atom bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/350933/5858626/a9604738-a27a-11e4-9cb3-e6b0d0432e99.PNG)
Label: bug

Title: Packages not finding updates
Body:
### Versions

**Atom:** 0.176.0-f7ecc3e
**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04
**settings-view:** 0.174.0

When going to the "Updates" section of "Settings", it says "All of your installed packages are up to date!". I have friends who are seeing packages updating. They are running previous versions of Atom ~0.173.0 on Linux. I also know for a fact there are updates, ie: `Linter` my current version is `0.10.0` and the newest version is `0.10.1`. I'm not sure what happened or when, but I have not received any updates for a few days now at least.

Issue still occurs when attempting `atom --safe` and `sudo atom`
Label: bug

Title: restart and install update restarts lost 1 window
Body:
I used the install and update button,

(but I did not know I was already in the latest version, so this should not have been available I guess)

I had 2 Atom windows open,
1 reopened well,
The second reopened showing the folder app-0.174.0 with the DLL inside
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536398/5856748/3a931058-a246-11e4-9f50-46ae6cd80e6c.png)
And I'm still in 0.174.0 (which is normal)
Label: bug

Title: Bundle Git with Atom
Body: I feel like Atom should come with everything needed to make it work. This includes Git for installing packages (arguably the most important feature of Atom). When you try to install a package without Git, it throws a pretty useless and confusing error. I think Atom should check to see if Git is installed, and if not, prompt the user to install it along side Atom.
Label: enhancement

Title: Unable to Install Certain Packages
Body:
I update my atom install going from the previous zip download, wiping all that away and using the new installer, but now certain packages won't install.

Here is my error output from the install command

```
npm ERR! Failed to clone git+https://github.com/Benvie/harmony-collections.git#e81b4b808359e2def9eeeabfdee69c2989e1fe96 from https://github.com/Benvie/harmony-collections.git fatal: could not create work tree dir 'C:\Users\Lucas\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-7196-e008f472\1421899379200-0.9844579449854791\e81b4b808359e2def9eeeabfdee69c2989e1fe96'.: No such file or directory

Title: Pasting or typing instead of selected text results in random selection
Body:
When I select some text and then paste something instead of it, sometimes I get random piece of the pasted text being selected. Look at the screencast:
![atom_paste_instead_selection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7574192/5847084/71d1d11a-a1da-11e4-93f3-d76f59c67e5c.gif)
Here I'm selecting pieces of text and pasting some other text. In one of three times it results in a part of the pasted text being selected.

It leads to some inconvenience in my work. After I replace selected text with text from the clipboard, I should check whether something is selected before I type anything (because the text I'm typing will replace the selection).

The same when I start typing while some text is selected. The typed symbol replaces the selection, but sometimes it becomes selected itself. So when I type the second symbol, it replaces the first one.

The behaviour which I observe in other text editors is: replace selected text with pasted/typed one, deselect anything, place the cursor after the pasted text. This is the most convenient option, I guess.

My Atom version is 0.175.0 (and I've observed it in all previous versions), my system - OS X 10.9.5.
Label: bug

Title: Atom hangs while trying to access networked paths
Body:
As mentioned in the title, Atom hangs while switching to a tab wherein the opened file is no longer accessible (in my case, from a network drive which I had lost connection to).

Is this a known issue?
This is perhaps related to issue #1766.
Label: bug

Title: Multiple tab regressions
Body:
I just upgraded to 0.174.0 from 0.172.0 today using Webupd8's PPA.
The 'x' button in each tab seems to be missing, and it therefore makes closing tabs much more difficult (now you have to right-click the tab you want to close and click `Close Tab`).

Replicated on Ubuntu 14.10, Atom 0.174.0, safe mode.  I don't think a picture is needed, but if you want one, just tell me.
Label: bug

Title: Uncaught Error: empty range in char class
Label: bug

Title: Gracefully suggest user to install git
Body:
I was trying out Atom on Windows, where I don't have git installed. I tried to install vim-mode, but the installation failed with the error code ENOGIT. In the installation log there was an error message much like that in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4030 

If the user actually reads the failure log, it'll become quite obvious that they need to install git / put it in their %PATH for the installation to succeed. However, I think it would be better (if possible) to notify the user about the need to install git with a dialog, for example. Another option would be to have a text "git is required to install this package" next to the package in the GUI.

Edit: of course the very simplest way would be to say somewhere on the download page, or in the installer, that installing git is required.
Label: enhancement

Title: Editor window is blank after switching tabs
Body:
When using Atom for a while and editing a single file within a project and then switching tabs to a different file the editor window is blank until it is scrolled, then the content of the current tab is rendered correctly.

Atom Version 0.174.0 on OSX 10.10.1.
Label: bug

Label: bug

Title: Atom does not run on RHEL 6.6
Body:
The Atom installation page says it supports RHEL. I have installed Atom on RHEL 6.6, and Atom doesn't work. The failed dependencies are with GLIBC_2.14, GLIBC_2.15, and libstdc++. 

/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/atom)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version`GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version`GLIBC_2.15' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)

So does this mean that RHEL 6.6 isn't supported? I have installed gcc 4.6.2 to get around the problem with libstdc++, but now am stuck with the glibc issues. My glibc version is 2.12.
Label: bug

Title: Warn users if they are installing/using pre-1.0 packages
Label: enhancement

Title: Panes are not restored correctly after a reload
Body:
Often when I reload, my panes are not restored with the right items. Maybe an exception is being thrown during teardown, preventing serialization from completing?
- [x] TextBuffer's history sometimes throws an exception during serialization, probably because `Checkpoints` don't implement `serialize`. atom/text-buffer@bfbee5f503dccc1aedc92ef1142f8cbccdc1021d
Label: bug

Title: Per-project config settings
Label: enhancement

Title: Improve app update experience
Label: enhancement

Title: Ability to specify display and space (OS X) within which to open a new window
Body:
I think it would be really useful to be able to tell atom to open a new window on a specific space which resides on a specific physical display. Use case would be in combination with a few other tools to create a new space on a specific display, open a terminal window with specific geometry, an atom window with specific geometry, both relative to the display's current resolution. (amongst other things)

there are workarounds I'm thinking about if this isn't possible, but if it's simple to add, it would simplify the scripting pipeline a bit.
Label: enhancement

Title: Add notification when user's stylesheet has styles broken by shadow DOM
Body: See https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4962
Label: enhancement

Title: find not working
Body: command-f and command-shift-f have completely stopped working. on osx yosemite. i tried reinstalling everything. can anyone confirm this?
Label: bug

Title: Atom.open opens new window even if newWindow is set to false.
Body:
Hi, I am bit confused about atom.open with newWindow option.

If I open the console and try running atom.open({'pathsToOpen': ['test.txt'], 'newWindow': false});  Test.txt opens in new window even though newWindow is set to false. If I run same command with absoluthe path to file, file opens in same window. I am curious if that's what this part of documentation is talking about:

> .newWindow A Boolean, true to always open a new window instead of reusing existing windows  **depending on the paths to open.**

So you need to provide absoluth path in order for file to open in same window?
Label: bug

Title: Gigantic menu fonts on HiDPI (Linux, GNOME)
Body:
I see that HiDPI support appears to mostly work in Atom, but with `org.gnome.desktop.interface` set to `2`, atom launches with menu items of a crazy size:

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/218205/5790894/a9baed6a-9eaf-11e4-8534-27727a242867.png)

Launching atom with `--force-device-scale-factor=1` appears to have no effect.

```
$ atom --version
0.174.0-2f76597
```

This was built from source on Gentoo Linux manually, because there's no ebuild available :-(
Label: bug

Title: Missing directory name when multiple files with same name in different tab groups
Body:
Using 0.174.0 on windows

When opening multiple files of the same name, the directory name is appended to the tab to allow the user to differentiate which version of the file each tab represents. 

This behaviour does not appear to work between different editor panes, the attachment below shows 3 .jshintrc files, the ones on the left correctly displaying the folder name (as it has two files called .jshintrc), while the third one in other pane (being the only .jshintrc in its window). If there is only one .jshintrc on each pane then they both do not show the folder name.

(.jshintrc is unrelated to the issue it just happened to be a file I had three of in a repository)

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4512498/5790160/f689b076-9e83-11e4-87cf-64fd9823f6bd.PNG)

Expected behaviour: folder name should be displayed if tab filename is not unique across all tabs, not just the tabs on that editor pane. This is how sublime behaves.
Label: bug

Title: Atom loses language-specific configs
Body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Start Atom (normally or in safe mode)
2. Change CoffeeScript Tab Length config (Settings→Packages→language-coffee-script→Tab Length)
3. Restart Atom
4. Observe CoffeeScript Tab Length config has reverted

Alternately: 
1. Start Atom
2. Add the following to config.cson and save:
   
   ``` cson
   '.coffee.source':
     'editor':
       'tabLength': 3
   ```
3. Observe indent guides change to three spaces
4. Restart Atom
5. Observe `.coffee.source` configs are missing, indent guides have reverted

**Atom Version**: 0.174.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1

Verified this happens even with a blank config:

"*":

![qq20150115-6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3364271/5744008/1e9efe78-9c58-11e4-92fb-8309de0cff27.png)

I think this title is to indicate the current file location, so this must be a bug..
Label: enhancement

Title: A mechanism to visit the parent folder in tree view
Body:
Why not add a mechanism in tree view that can visit it's parent folder?
like add a line .. on the top of tree view

Now I must do "Show in Finder" —> find the file in parent folder -> drag it into Atom ->"Reveal in tree view" to show the parent folder content in the tree view.

By the way, if you really do so, you will find you can not get the tree view of the parent folder. It only highlights the current folder. See more detail in #4524 

Thank you
Label: enhancement

Title: Paste without formatting/indentation
Body:
In #1407 @nathansobo wrote:

> I wonder if we should offer a non-normalized variant of paste, like alt-cmd-v.

Opening this issue to ask for the above.

Rationale: I leave auto indentation on, and it (mostly) does the right thing, but sometimes I am moving code around that has indentation rules more complicated than Atom can understand. I'd love to have a quick way to paste the "raw" text without having Atom try to indent it. Kind of like "paste without formatting" in a spreadsheet.

An example of complicated indentation might be a docstring, or PEP8-style indenting to opening parens in Python. Ideally Atom would understand all these rules and do the right thing, but right now I often find myself re-indenting things after Atom strips them during paste.
Label: enhancement

Title: API for Creating Custom Gutters
Body:
## Motivation

The Decorations API allows you to attach a class to gutters (and other things) and thus style them. However, we are working on a feature that requires us to be able to add our own HTML elements to the gutter, and would like to propose an API to do that.

**Feature:**
We would like to add buttons to the gutter next to lines that contain a test definition. Clicking on the button would run that test. (This is similar to functionality in Xcode.)

**Why CSS doesn't work:**
Adding CSS only allows us to create “buttons? via :before or :after pseudo-elements. These elements can't respond to events targeted to them; instead, any events they receive will register on the existing “line-number? gutter element. The gutter element already has another action to take in response to a click: it may expand or collapse a section of code. If we tried to add events to the gutter element itself (instead of a new child div), our events would conflict with the existing events from Atom.

**How the Line Numbers in the Gutter Work, Currently:**
When the editor is scrolled, line-number divs that have scrolled offscreen are removed, and new line-number divs for newly onscreen lines are added. The changes are primarily in the GutterComponent class, in “appendOrUpdateVisibleLineNumberNodes? (which calls into “buildLineNumberHTML?) and “removeLineNumberNodes?.

**Proposed Change:**
1. The most flexibility that an Atom API could offer is the ability to accept a function that will be run on each line-number div after it's added (and before it's removed, for any teardown work). In practice, this could lead to changes that affect things that might be considered “core? to Atom's look. It seems like this opens too much flexibility.
2. A more pared-down API that Atom could offer is the ability to add a column next to the gutter (either on the left side or right side, though it's understandable to limit this to the left side because the right side is occupied by “foldability?). The API for a Gutter object would accept a function that is given the line number, and returns a div for that line number, which would be inserted into the DOM next to the appropriate line number. (It would make sense for this insertion to be done in Atom Core code, because it already manages the positioning of the line numbers and does this via absolute positioning for performance optimisation.) 
## Desired Gutter Features

**Adding Gutters**
- Create gutter
  - You will most likely create one gutter instance per editor instance.
- API to add a gutter to an editor
  - Indicate whether to position it to the left or right of the line numbers
  - Pass a “z-index? of sorts to indicate how close/far from the edge it should be, similar to the “priority? argument to Atom.Workspace.add---Panel.

**Removing Gutters**
- Remove from view (toggle)
- Destroy

**Gutter Properties to Set**
- Set the width (?)

**Modifying Gutter Contents**
- Insert something inside a div next to each line
  - Initialize the Gutter object with a function that operates on a line number and returns a DOM element. As line-number divs are inserted and removed as the user scrolls, this function is run to determine what to place in the custom gutter next to each line number.
  - API could also allow:
    - Changing this function
    - Clear all the items in the gutter (a convenience)
  - For performance, by default, this function could run just once at initialization on the currently-displayed line numbers, and be run on progressively more line numbers as the user scrolls. The results could be cached.
    - The Gutter API should also expose a method that triggers the function to be run on the currently-displayed line numbers, or on a specific line. This could be useful if you want to update the gutter without the editor being scrolled.
Label: enhancement

Title: Multi-line editing becomes unusable with large selections
Body: I've just tried to multi-line edit a file with 400 lines produced by `find .` All of lines the started with ./, so I selected the first ./, kept on pressing CTRL+D to capture them all. Around line 250-300, the editor would slow down a bit, but the selection finished quickly. Then I started typing a few characters, and the first took several seconds to appear, while the second didn't appear even after 30 seconds. That makes multi-line editing pretty much useless.
Label: bug

Title: Umlaute not displayed correctly
Body:
Atom is currently having issues with displaying umlaute (äüö).
When an umlaut character is typed or pasted it appears until the end of the line.

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 50 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720388/c0aaee9c-9b23-11e4-81f5-a0261557cb28.png)

When it is removed, everything looks just fine:

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 51 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720387/be19a90c-9b23-11e4-8c23-45bb4fc14037.png)

It also seem to be related to syntax highlighting, when selecting "Plain Text", everything is fine:

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 52 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720385/bbe8efee-9b23-11e4-9185-d75cd153e118.png)

Issue found on Arch Linux, build 0.171.0-296409d
Working without issues on Windows.

Document is UTF-8.

Tested with Syntax Highlighting for C, C++, Javascript, Latex and PHP. (Might affect other languages too, but I did not test it. I believe every language is affected.)
Label: bug

Body:
Steps to reproduce:

**Atom Version**: 0.169.0
**System**: linux 3.13.0-43-generic
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

  at ClientRequest.onError (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/less-cache/node_modules/less/node_modules/request/node_modules/tunnel-agent/index.js:168:17)
  at ClientRequest.g (events.js:199:16)

4. Click on Packages-> Settings View -> Uninstall Packages from the top bar --- works

Title: Package config type Number and minimum value doesn't always work
Body:
I've created a configuration variable in my package that looks like this:

``` javascript
    monocleHeight: {
      title: 'Monocle Height',
      description: 'How much of the workspace to use for build panel when it is "maximized".',
      type: 'number',
      default: 0.75,
      minimum: 0.1,
      maximum: 0.9
    }
```

Now, editing this variable in the Settings View, if I write `0`, it correctly changes it to `0.1`. However, if I write `0.01` it doesn't do .

Similar with maximum, if I write `1.4` it correctly changes it to `0.9`. Typing `2.0` and it doesn't change anything.

Good part: It never writes config with incorrect values, and never issues my config observe callbacks with incorrect values either. It's just bad feedback to the user.
Label: bug

Title: Atom doesn't update file buffers correctly when switching branches.
Body:
Steps to reproduce.
1. `git checkout master`
2. `git checkout -b new_feature`
3. Open Atom with no files loaded.
4. Open an existing file and modify it. Keep it open.
5. `git commit -am "Modifying file"`
6. `git checkout master`

At this point you'd expect to see that the edits which you made would be gone since you are now viewing a different branch. However, the edits show up and git diff even highlights them.

Also PR #1271 supposedly fixed #693 (Closing file buffers when a file gets removed via git i.e. switching branches, deleting, etc.) but that is not happening for me. When I switch branches and a file gets removed, it stays open in Atom with no indication that it's not supposed to be there.

Edit: Personally I think a file getting removed via git should automatically close the buffer, while a file getting removed in another way should prompt you. "This file no longer exists, do you want to keep it open?". This is how Notepad++ handles the situation and I think that is the best way.
Label: bug

Title: Atom should attempt to reinstall incompatible packages when node is upgraded
Body: After upgrading node, any packages that have native module dependencies become incompatible. The incompatible packages view offers 3 options: Check for Update, Report Issue and Disable Package. But often the only thing that the package needs is for its modules to be recompiled against the new version. The user is stuck with a package that can't be used until they manually uninstall and reinstall it. Atom should attempt to reinstall these packages, and only consider them incompatible if the reinstall fails.
Label: enhancement

Title: Periodically check for available updates
Body:
Could we get an indicator when there's an update available for Atom, in addition to the file menu?  If someone leaves Atom open for days at a time, they could easily end up several versions behind.

I'm picturing something like Chrome's indicator, where the hamburger icon goes from green->yellow->red depending on how stale the user's version is.  Maybe just a little light in the status bar.
Label: enhancement

Title: Better documentation for Disposables
Body:
One of the most common issues I've noticed with Atom packages is they fail to dispose their Disposables. This causes a whole load of problems with callbacks being registered multiple times when updating packages (or disabling and re-enabling them). Updating packages to fix issues often doesn't work because the old, broken callbacks stick around until you restart Atom.

The package development documentation hasn't really been updated since Disposables were introduced. [Your First Package](https://atom.io/docs/v0.169.0/your-first-package) and the [ascii-art package](https://github.com/atom/ascii-art/blob/master/lib/ascii-art.coffee) show how to register commands, but don't hold on to the Disposable, and don't call `dispose` in the `deactivate` method:

``` coffee
atom.workspaceView.command "ascii-art:convert", => @convert()
```

A few examples of popular packages not behaving properly:
### emmet

https://github.com/emmetio/emmet-atom/blob/60ad28616defddc8fb8746476717cc726b53b15b/lib/emmet.coffee#L117
### linter

https://github.com/AtomLinter/Linter/blob/eff2c313efc240aca8d4bc3f9b7dc811988c8bd4/lib/linter-view.coffee#L94
https://github.com/AtomLinter/Linter/blob/eff2c313efc240aca8d4bc3f9b7dc811988c8bd4/lib/linter-view.coffee#L116
### color-picker

https://github.com/thomaslindstrom/color-picker/blob/e9b64487f827223ca9ec0479f7075db48b43f02d/lib/ColorPicker.coffee#L18
### atomatigit

https://github.com/diiq/atomatigit/blob/d521a615517e4e0643987cc4e02fd3a307205be0/lib/atomatigit.coffee#L43

So package developers often have no idea they're missing something. I think this is unfortunately contributing to a negative image - while Atom's core packages are great, users are bound to associate the problems caused by third party packages with Atom itself.

It needs to be made more explicit that when you register commands or other callbacks, you need to hold on to the Disposable, and you need to dispose it properly when you're done with it.
Label: enhancement

Title: Common uncaught errors
Body:
I went through the uncaught errors looking for patterns. I know there are some we see over and over. It would be nice to dig into these.

These are ordered by apparent frequency.
### Permission / file doesnt exist / file in use issues

These just need better error messages. e.g.
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4797
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4850

Should be an easy fix, difficulty is catching all the cases.
#### Error from pathwatcher

Seems like a path is being watched, then something happens to that file, and pathwatcher freaks out

https://github.com/atom/atom/labels/error-from-pathwatcher
#### No trace; At fs.js:75
- EBUSY open: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4735
- EBUSY unlink: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4805
- ENOENT unlink: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4874
### Unable to watch path
- https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher/issues/39 (windows)
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+unable+to+watch+path

Seems almost entirely linux based. Not sure how to fix.
### Spawn /atom/dir/atom ENOENT

Again, mostly linux. But a handful in OSX too. We need to figure out how to reproduce.
- linux: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4505
- osx: (these might be different?) https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4538, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4754, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4538
### EEXIST .atom/storage exists

Again, we need to reproduce

https://github.com/atom/atom/issues?q=is%3Aissue+EEXIST+storage+is%3Aopen
Label: bug

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1423115/5648585/df87f05a-968f-11e4-87bc-ae2b5b6f9280.png)

Chrome has eg an chrome.exe in:
C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome SxS\Application which starts chrome with the currect folder.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1423115/5648575/c9bdcde4-968f-11e4-9f63-42fc08e3f0b5.png)
Label: enhancement

Label: bug

Title: Wrong git modified color when using git subtree
Body:
Hi!

I have a git subtree under my directory `src/Rockbee/CoreBundle` and everything is up-to-date. Atom shows all other files as if they are modified (in yellow). Probably the file tree coloring is not dealing with subtrees correctly. Has anyone had the same problem? Maybe someone can give me some ideas on how to fix it on atom module. Thanks in advance.

![screenshot 2015-01-07 10 10 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/497957/5645348/90022616-9655-11e4-86aa-940c9011ca96.png)
Label: enhancement

Title: File replacement does not work against directories
Body:
When saving a new file, if you decide to save it as the same name of a directory (no extension), it will ask if you would like to replace it. If you choose yes, it will error saying that that file is already a directory 

I am running Atom 0.165.0 for OSX.

There is no log in the debug console to provide.

There are basically three solutions to this:
1. Have it error after the "replace" button is clicked but before the dialog box is closed
2. Have it replace the directory
3. Have it handle directories and files separately (I'm not sure about other operating systems, but I'm pretty sure on OSX it considers them <name>.folder)
Label: bug

Title: Double-click (and triple-click) selection, followed by shift+left/up arrows to expand or shrink selection, assumes rightward or downward change
Body:
To match behavior of browsers and other editors the assumption should be to expand the selection in the direction pressed, i.e.

Double-click a word. Press shift + left.
- Expected behavior: Selection expands one character to the left.
- Actual behavior: Selection diminishes by one character from the right.

Double-click a word. Press shift + up.
- Expected behavior: Selection expands one line up with the resulting left-most character in new selection vertically aligned with the left of the originally selected word.
- Actual behavior: Original selection is lost, new selection starts at the character preceding the original selected word, left-most character aligns vertically with last letter of the previous selection.

There are similar issues when throwing in the Command key to expand selections to beginning of lines and beginning or pages.
Label: enhancement

Title: "Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path" Windows / Linux samba share
Body:
I run into this issue repeatedly. I know there are already a bunch of reports about this error message, but it's hard to tell what are duplicates because of all the variations. When I get this now it's paired with a second error:

```
Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path
Uncaught ReferenceError: spawnSync is not defined
```

(See bottom for detailed version.)

The details about my situation:

Atom (currently 0.153.0), no packages installed, running on Windows 7 x64.

Atom will run fine for some amount of time, then I try to open a file and get this error. It doesn't seem to be related to renaming files, as in some of the other reports. At least sometimes I can still open a file in a different window. At least sometimes I can open a file in the same window with a different path. For example, I'm often loading files from a samba share running on Ubuntu 12, e.g.

`\\server\share\somedir\somefile`

When the problem strikes I don't seem to be able to load any more files from `\\server\share\somedir` in the same window. But if I map a drive to the same share, I seem to be able to load files from there, e.g.:

`Z:\somedir\somefile`

I've already tried setting `fs.inotify.max_user_watches` to `32768` (on the Ubuntu system) as suggested in #2082 and the problem persists.

```
Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path c:\Program Files (x86)\GitHub Atom\resources\app\node_modules\pathwatcher\lib\main.js:66

  module.exports.File.subscribeToNativeChangeEvents c:\Program Files (x86)\GitHub Atom\resources\app\node_modules\pathwatcher\lib\file.js:364

Title: Open Directory Opens ~ Instead of Selected Directory on Linux
Body:
- Atom version: v0.165.0
- OS: elementaryOS 0.2 "Luna" (64-bit)

Minor, but annoying if you like your projects hoisted into the sidebar. This seems to work fine on Windows 7.
Label: bug

Title: Files with .lang.example suffix should be treated as .lang
Body:
If I have a file `config.toml.sample`, it should be treated as a `.toml` file in terms of syntax highlighting, linting, etc. Similar suffixes I've seen in the wild:
- `.sample`
- `.example`
Label: enhancement

Title: Decorations on soft-wrap borders should not stretch across the border
Body:
I don't think that the spell-check package is doing anything wrong here, so I assume that this visual bug is due to decorations stretching across soft-wrap boundaries when maybe they shouldn't:

![screen shot 2015-01-04 at 10 17 03 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/5606912/de32d7fc-93fa-11e4-985e-02304d21b02b.png)

_(As a side note, I'm impressed that supercalifragilisticexpialidocious is in the OS X dictionary. I had to come up with another long nonsense word :laughing:)_

I would expect that "absafragginglutely" would be decorated, but _not_ the space between "absafragginglutely" and the previous instance of the word "testing".

Atom v0.166.0-25b44ce on Mac OS X 10.10.1

/cc @benogle
Label: bug

Title: Show zoom level (in status bar?)
Body:
I wasn't sure the best place to put this (maybe [status-bar?](https://github.com/atom/status-bar)), but it would be nice to be able to see the zoom level somewhere in the UI. Since it's possible to zoom using `Cmd + -` / `Cmd + =`, it's possible to not realize the editor is zoomed because there's no way of telling.

It might also be cool to have some kind of visual feedback when you do zoom - maybe some kind of modal alert that pops up saying "Zoom: 125%" (for example) and fades away.
Label: enhancement

Title: Make Find UI position lockable
Body:
The Find UI is a bar across the bottom of the editor.  I also have a linter which places a bar across the bottom.  Depending on what line the cursor is on, the linter output will contain 0+ lines, so the linter bar height varies depending on the line.

When I search for a term, I click the 'Find' button.  The cursor moves to the next found instance, and the linter height changes, moving the 'Find' button away from my mouse cursor.  In effect, I have to look down at the mouse cursor and point it at the 'Find' button every time I want to find the next instance of the search term.  

It is common to browse code looking for instances of a search term, and this seems like a simple fix to make usable.  An option to affix the Find bar at the very bottom would do the trick.
Label: enhancement

Title: Want API for changing the cursor blink rate
Body: I don't see any documentation for this, so maybe it's my fault, but I would like an API for changing the cursor blink speed. It's faster than most other apps on OS X, and the inconsistency squicks my CDO. I definitely don't need or want it changed in the base app, but would like the ability to make a package for it. I am aware of [ease-blink](https://atom.io/packages/ease-blink) but I don't see the API it uses in the documentation, and the search isn't finding it. I will freely admit that I am brand new to Atom and thus am probably missing something; pointers to the manual would be greatly appreciated, if that's what I'm missing!
Label: enhancement

Title: Unfocused Password For Protected Files
Body: When saving a protected file, such as http-vhosts.conf, Atom displays an authentication dialog. But the password field is unfocused requiring the user to click on the dialog and the field. It would be much more convenient of Atom would focus on that password field automatically.
Label: enhancement
